Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el objetivo de mejorar sus servicios de tal forma que esto permita atraer a nuevos clientes. Por lo tanto el crédito lo solicita para invertir en: tijeras, brochas, peines, gel, etc. Confía plenamente en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta manera logrará su objetivo.
texts.en: Denny Adenir, age 35, lives with his partner and three children in their family home. Denny is a hard-working man who never gets tired of working hard for his family's well being, day in and day out. His family is his main inspiration. They motivate him to work hard in order to give them a quality of life better than the one he has had. He is completely dedicated to his business, which he established several years ago. He runs a barber shop, where he can do various hair cuts, especially for men. He has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL with the goal of improving his services in order to attract more clientele. He will invest this loan in: scissors, shaving brushes, combs, gel, etc. He trusts in God completely, and in his work--this is how he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy: scissors, shaving brushes, combs, gel, etc.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Tumaini Farmers Group Ngima

texts.en:
Edesius is a 59-year-old father of four children with one child attending secondary school. He is an experienced farmer, growing coffee, maize, and beans for over 12 years. He is facing agricultural problems basically due to crop diseases and a lack of fertilizer.

Edesius is seeking funds to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. Also, he has a commitment in five years to expand his production from 7 to 20 acres in expectation of increasing his income, which can be used to buy food and clothes and to pay school fees for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Vijana Nguvu Mpya Lugari Group

texts.en:
Daud is a 33-year-old married man, with one child. He has been doing farming activities, producing maize, beans and coffee, for more than 11 years. His income is low, due to crop diseases and a lack of fertilizers and productive maize seeds.

Daud is working hard to find working capital to pay for fertilizers, productive maize seeds and insecticides. His desire is to boost his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres so as to earn more income that can be utilized to fix his house and to buy food and clothes, and to bank the surplus.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and productive maize seeds.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a 36-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children in the Mafraq district. His job as a member of the civil defence helps to support his household and cover his daily expenses, but it hasn’t dampened his ambitions to do better and finish his education to obtain a B.A. degree. All the obstacles in front of him, including his age and work, did not prevent him from registering with a university and taking political sciences as a major to improve his lifestyle and provide more for his family.
Therefore, Jumaa would like a loan to pay his university fees and continue with his dream of attaining a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: to  pay a semester's fees.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Thmor Koul district, Thorn is a 51-year-old farmer who grows vegetables as a primary business to make her living. She has been with this business for more than three years and she supplements her income from her children who work for others. Thorn started taking loans from VisionFund three years ago. The previous loans from VisionFund have helped her to have a regular income and some savings for the future. Currently, she earns ten U.S. dollars per day. 

Thorn and the other two members in the group, who have been with VisionFund for three years and five years, are applying for another loan. She will use the entire loan to buy vegetables seeds and prepare land for her farm. She hopes to grow more vegetables and to earn more income to build on some savings so as to afford a bigger house in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables seeds and prepare land for her farm.

loans.name: Nguvukazi Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Joachim is a 40 years old a father of four children, one attending secondary education. He has been producing coffee, maize and beans for over seven years. He is facing farming problems, especially lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Joachim is looking for financial support to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Again he works to expand production from 6 to 13 acres, in five years to come. He hopes to earn more funds that can be allocated to pay for medical expenses, school fees and to purchase clothes.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 50 years old, married and has three children. He is a farmer who does livestock farming. He has employed one person in his business. He also grows potatoes to earn additional income. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Julius has been trained on business management skills and he has learned how to manage his business. Julius hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

Julius needs a loan of 10,900 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp. He will use the lamp to light his house because he lives in a rural area where there is no electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth, 46, is a married mother of four children. Two of her children work for others for fees, while the last two are still in school. Sareth started farming on her one-hectare farmland, more than five years ago, to earn a living and she supplements her income by buying and selling tamarinds. With her current business, she earns less than three U.S. dollars per day and saves one U.S. dollar per day. 

Sareth and her group member have been with VisionFund for six years. The previous loans have helped her sufficiently feed her family. Now she is requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy tamarinds for her business. She hopes to grow her business and earn more income. She would like to set aside some money to afford a bigger house in the future. She also wishes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Reuy's Group

texts.en:
Reuy is 50 years old, married, and has four dependent children. Three of her children are working in Thailand while the last one is still in school. Reuy is a farmer who has been farming on her rice field for more than ten years to earn her living in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district. To better feed her family, she supplements her income by raising pigs and selling rice soup to raise additional income. Now she earns around ten U.S. dollars per day from her business and saves around four U.S. dollars per day. 

Having been with VisionFund for six loan cycles, Reuy leads a group of six female members who have also been with VisionFund from one year to seven years. They are applying for another loan, as a group. She wants to use the entire loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crops. This loan will enable her to make more rice and she hopes to make good income and set aside some money to afford a bigger house. She also wants keep her fourth child in schooling.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest her rice crops.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, married and has five children. He does livestock farming to earn his living. John has been farming for over ten years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has opened another outlet of his business in a different location.  

John has requested for 10,900 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house because he has no access to electricity and has been using a kerosene lamp.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 50 years old, widowed and has three children, only one still in school. Being a widowed mother, she has been selling Chinese noodle and rice soup to make a living. She has been with this business for more than ten years. She started taking a loan from Vision Fund four years ago. The loans from Vision Fund have helped her have regular income and send her child to school. Now she earns more than twenty U.S. dollars per day from her current business and saves less than five U.S. dollars per day.

Hoeurn and her group member Ngeb who has been with Vision Fund for three years are applying for another loan. She will use this loan to buy ingredients and foodstuffs for her business. She hopes to grow her business and make a good profit and also keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another outlet of her business

loans.name: Ri's Group

texts.en:
Ri, aged 51, is widowed and has six children, three of whom are dependents. She is a farmer who has been farming on her rice field and planting cassava for more than ten years to earn a living in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district. She started taking a loan from Vision Fund three years ago. The loans have helped her have regular income and make her business grow.

Now Ri and her group member Thoeurn who has also been with Vision Fund for three years are requesting another loan. Ri will use this loan to hire workers to harvest her rice paddy and cassava crops. She hopes to increase her crops and sell for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her rice paddy and cassava crops

loans.name: Ebtesam

texts.en:
Ebtesam is a 40-year-old divorced woman from Irbid, Jordan. She has a home-based project in which she sells clothes and Abaya, the traditional dress worn by women in the Middle East. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more Abaya and clothes for trading purposes.
Ebtesam is looking to open a shop for her business so that she increase her customer base as well as her income. She is also looking to purchase a home.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and Abaya for trading purposes.

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende is 43 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, she sells health products.  She has been in the business for one year.  She also does farming in her rural home so as to earn additional income.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained on business management.
Mwende needs a loan of 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 27-year-old married woman from Irvbid, Jordan, and is a mother of three children.
Yasmeen sells clothes from her home and is requesting a loan of 4,100 JOD to purchase more clothes for the winter season. Yasmeen is looking to have a shop for her products so that she can better display her clothes and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Nareman

texts.en:
Nareman is a 28-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan, and is a mother of two children.
Nareman is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase clothes for trading purposes. She is looking to have a shop near her home so that she can sell more clothes and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick makes mainly tea and doughnuts in his cafeteria. He has been running the business for nine years and has employed two people.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and learned how to manage his finances.  He hopes to expand his business and start outside catering services.
Erick needs a loan of 30, 000 Kenya shillings to buy plastic chairs for his cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs for his cafeteria

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 41-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan, and is a mother of one child.
Hind has a beauty salon which started as a home-based salon. With hard work, she was able to expand her business into an established salon near her home.
Hind is now requesting a loan of 500 JOD to license the salon and purchase new equipment. She is looking to open a barber shop for her husband so that they can increase their income together and improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to license her salon and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and married. To earn a living, he does shoe repairs. He has employed one person in his business. John has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

John has requested for a loan of 85,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoe soles and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles and leather.

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en:
Heraclea works hard to support her family. Heraclea is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Heraclea has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials. Heraclea has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Heraclea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is 61 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Iluminada has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Iluminada has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old, married and has 5 children. With 3 children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Josephine has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
Jumdah is 36 years old and married. She has 4 children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jumdah runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Jumdah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 37 years old and has 3 children. Marieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a egg retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

Marieta has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the eggs retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from her general store.

Marieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 32 years old and married with one child currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.
Mary Jane has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, canned goods, purified water, etc. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fifteen years now.

Mercy requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment. 

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 35 years old, married, and has three children currently going to school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed fourteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 27 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and a high school graduate.

For eight years now Mama has been operating an electrical shop, where she sells radios, sound systems, etc.  Most interestingly, she has many customers since her business is in a very good location. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more radios and sound systems for her business; she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more radios and sound systems for her business.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 41 years old, married, and has four children. With two children in school, Liezl works very hard to provide for them.

Liezl runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, sugar, spices, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Liezl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ma.linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is 51 years old and married, with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Linda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Linda has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruby Flor

texts.en:
Ruby Flor is married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ruby Flor is 47 years old and has one child, who is in school.

Ruby Flor has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Ruby Flor has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Saripa

texts.en:
Saripa works hard to support her family. Saripa is married and has an ambulant vending grocery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Saripa has requested a loan of PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Saripa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to by more stock to sell.

loans.name: Neza

texts.en:
Neza is 24 years old and married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Neza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy bamboo, a fishing net, binders, and other fishing materials.

Neza has been in this business for three years. In the future, Neza would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, a fishing net, binders, and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en: Solita is 46 years old and married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, Solita works very hard to provide for them. She has operated an ambulant dry goods business in the Philippines for 15 years. Solita has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. In the future, Solita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for 10 years. Teresita has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 16 years. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo and fishing net for her business. Evangeline earns additional income from clothing sales.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo and fishing net .

loans.name: Gerrybeth

texts.en: Gerrybeth is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from food sales. Gerrybeth has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for fishing. In the future, Gerrybeth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is 55 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vicenta has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 12 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items, such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries, to sell. Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 36 years old and has a common-law husband and two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Almira runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Almira has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Almira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 37 years old and married with two children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for thirteen years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jessica aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 74 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her store.

Carmelina has been in this business for eighteen years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, milk, noodles, etc.  

In the future, Carmelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Giljoy

texts.en:
Giljoy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her dried fish business.

Giljoy has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from frozen foods.

Giljoy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Judith works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling starfish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from trisikad (pedicab) transportation. Judith is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more starfish to sell to customers.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more starfish to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, 40 years old, is married and has two children.  He has operated a grocery store for eight years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has been able to access financial resources easily. Stephen has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy fruits and  vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Villa

texts.en:
Ma. Villa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a restaurant business in the Philippines for 3 years. Ma. Villa earns additional income from fruit sales and a sari-sari (variety) store. She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ma. Villa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Jimmy is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has five children, although only two are still in school. He began the poultry farming two years ago. Besides this, Jimmy also does printing. He is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase broilers, feeds and drugs. The main challenge in his business is animal diseases and the high cost of feeds. He looks forward to being a large scale poultry farmer.
He will use the extra income from this loan to pay for college fees and he will invest the rest of the income.

loans.use: to purchase broiler hens, feeds and drugs.

loans.name: Elisa Jessica

texts.en:
Elisa Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food sales business in the Philippines for 9 years. She earns additional income from a variety store. Elisa Jessica is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elisa Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Naty

texts.en: Naty, 61 years old, is married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Naty has operated a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 7 years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, coffee, canned goods, spices, etc. Naty has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future Naty would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling rugs in the Philippines.

Maria Theresa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug business.

loans.name: Mamadou Lamine

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune enseignant récemment marié  sans enfant.Il a servi pendant trois ans à l'intérieur du pays dans une zone ou la transformation du bois mort en charbon est la principale activité économique des populations.Pour améliorer ses revenus, il s'est lancé dans ce commerce en convoyant de temps en temps des sacs vers sa ville d'origine.Aujourd'hui affecté dans une école de cette ville, il a renforcé son commerce.Il arrive à générer ainsi des revenus très consistant qui lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Il sollicite ainsi auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 300 000f pour acheter 200 sacs de charbon de bois. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a young teacher who was recently married and doesn't have any children. He served for three years in the interior of the country in a zone where the transformation of dead wood into charcoal is the principal economic activity of the population. To increase his income, he embarked on a business venture where he transports bags of charcoal to his city of origin from time to time. Today posted to a school in this city, he has increased his business. In this way he succeeds in generating very consistent revenue that allows him to improve the living conditions of his family. Therefore he seeks a loan of 300,000f from UIMCEC in order to buy 200 bags of charcoal. His ambition is to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy 200 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 51 years old and married with one child.

Sherlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a beauty products retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional beauty products to sell.

Sherlita has borrowed and repaid twenty-eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the beauty products retail business for twelve years and also earns an income from raising pigs and from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Sherlita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Vevincia

texts.en:
Vevincia, a 57-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a rice retail business in the Philippines for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Having borrowed and repaid 28 previous loans from NWTF, Vevincia is now requesting a new one for PHP 29000 to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliza is 42-years old and has four children who are in school.

Flordeliza has a food vending (rice cakes) business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 7 years. Flordeliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is married and has 3 children, one of whom is in school.

Dulce is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Dulce requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Dulce has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dulce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Felipa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to their community.

She has been in this business for 40 years now and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Felipa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a business-man who runs a motorbike transport business. He also does farming for more income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business. This is because he has been trained about business management skills through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. He has requested for a loan of 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is 36-years-old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Clarisa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarisa has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising carabao (water buffalo).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara, 26, lives with her common-law husband and five children, two of whom are in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, Clara has had a rope-making business in the Philippines for eight years and is now requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Maria Linda is 51 years old and married with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. Maria Linda has operated a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 3 years. She also earns additional income from billiards. Maria Linda has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her store.

Maria Linda has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nelcy

texts.en:
Nelcy, 36 years old, is married and has 2 children. Nelcy works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a variety store in the Philippines for 4 years and also earns an income from rope making. Nelcy has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nelcy has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma.liza

texts.en: Ma.Liza is 41 years old and married with 3 children. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and ready-to-wear clothing. Ma.Liza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ma.Liza  works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Nancy works hard to support her family. She operates a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nancy is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a food sales business in the Philippines for 5 years. Gloria has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more snack foods to sell to customers. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated an oyster farm in the Philippines for 5 years. She earns additional income from selling dried fish. Marilou is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo, binders and other materials to repair her oyster farm.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo, binders and other materials to repair her oyster farm.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Cheryl works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 2 years. She also earns additional income from a variety store, gasoline retail sales and an oyster farm.

Zenaida has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy paint, bamboo and other equipment to repair her fishing boat. Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy paint, bamboo and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en: Basilisa, 52 years old, is married and has 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Basilisa has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. In the future, Basilisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Kédiaw  Diabate

texts.fr: l'emprunteuse est une femme mariée sans enfants. Elle exerce un commerce de d'huile de palm et de miel.Elle vit avec son mari et son petit frère dans la maison de ses parents, tous deux décédés.Elle a démarré son activité avec des fonds reçus de la tontine de son quartier. Pour renforcer son commerce , elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000f de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 100 litres d'huile de palm et 50 litres de miel. Son ambition est d'établir une cantine au marché central pour mieux écouler ses produits.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman without children. She has a business selling palm oil and honey. She lives with her husband and her little brother in her parents' house, both of whom are deceased. She started up her business with funds received from her area's tontine, or community lending institution. To strengthen her business, she seeks a loan of 150,000f from UIMCEC to buy 100 liters of palm oil and 50 liters of honey. Her ambition is to establish a canteen at the central market to better sell her products.

loans.use: to buy 200 liters of palm oil and 50 liters of honey.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and her husband is a security personnel. They have two children aged 2 and 11, who live at home with their parents.

For the past 3 years, Betty has been operating a grocery shop where she sells toothpaste, cosmetics, detergent, soap, rice and many other items. She has many customers since her business is in a very good location. Betty is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her business. She plans to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, detergent, soap, rice and many other items for her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 42 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children ages 19, 24,and 29. They live at home and the two  younger once are currently in high school, while the older one is out of high school and attending university. For the past two years now, Hawa has been selling fashion clothes, chains, earrings,and many others items.she started her business through friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, and trousers), chains, earrings, and many others items for her business. She plans to expand her business to help her children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, and trousers), chains, earrings, and many others items for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa lives in West Point. She is 46 years old, married, and a university student. For five years now, Theresa has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes. Most interestingly, she has many customers because she is the only one who sells quality fashion clothes in her community.

Theresa is requesting a loan to buy more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, and shirts) and many other items for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trouser, and shirts) and many items for her business.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is 35 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, of whom one is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Josef has been working hard to manage his small bar, which sells drinks.

To help expand his business, Josef has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks for resale, and will help Josef to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Josef hopes that in the future he will be able to construct more rental houses. 

Josef is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josef who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Ssebatta

texts.en:
Ssebatta is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, of whom three are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Ssebatta has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells shoes.

To help expand his business, Ssebatta has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for resale, and will help Ssebatta to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ssebatta hopes that in the future he will be able to construct his house. 

Ssebatta is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ssebatta who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 34 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, she has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells shoes.

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for resale, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 41 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past 11 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing.

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids for the hair, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and expand her business. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her childrens' standards of living. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy braids for the hair.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and live in Bardnersville. She’s married and her husband is a contractor, they have three children ages 9 through 12, all of who live at home and are presently in school.

For four years now, Evelyn has been involved in the cement business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for her business. She hopes to send her children to a quality school and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cement for her business.

loans.name: Dizzy

texts.en:
Dizzy is 35 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children. For the past 6 years, Dizzy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap.

To help expand her business, Dizzy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Dizzy to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for her children. Dizzy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Dizzy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dizzy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 42 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Christine to generate greater profits, improving her capital. Christine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up another retail shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 43 years old and lives in Paynesville, South, Liberia. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have five children between the ages of  9 and 24 years old. The children are currently in school and live at home.

For the past eight years Dorris has been selling coal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal bags for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal bags for her business.

loans.name: Victor  Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Víctor  nació en Santa Cruz,  vive actualmente en la localidad de  San Luis  hace mas de 12 años, tiene su hija  de  15 años es padre soltero, el trabaja como albañil en la misma localidad y también trabaja como sereno en la iglesia  los fines de semana por la  noche, el lo necesita el crédito compra de materiales de construcción para terminar su construcción ya que quiere darle un mejor lugar donde viva su hija y esta construyendo un cuarto para ella y mas que todo privado, donde pueda descansar solo ella, el es un cliente antiguo  solo se quedo a trabajar con nosotros, no tiene otra deuda ya que la institución   lo ha  atendido en el momento mas preciso y esta muy  agradecido por eso.
texts.en:
Víctor was born in Santa Cruz and has been living in the town of San Luis for more than 12 years now.

He is a single father with a 15-year-old daughter and works as a building worker in the same town where he lives, and also as a night security guard at the church during the weekends.

He needs this loan to buy construction materials to finish his construction work as he wants to give her daughter a better place to live in, so he is building a private room which is only for her to sleep in.

He is a longstanding client who has worked only with us. He hasn't got any debts as he is very grateful to the institution for having helped him when he really needed it.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish his construction work.

loans.name: Yanit

texts.es: El señora Yanit tiene como actividad  la confección de deportivos,  que realiza juntamente con su esposo durante  dos años, tiene un hijo de menor de cinco años, su esposo esta trabajando en una empresa textil  en turno de la mañana, el momento de la visita se encontraban confeccionando en su domicilio ubicado en la zona villa ingenio del Alto ,  su venta  es quincenalmente en la localidad de desaguadero frontera con Perú, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de una maquina industrial de doble aguja para cubrir su demanda que tiene, así para tener un mejor ingreso para vivir mejor.
texts.en: Yanit has been making sports clothing along with her husband for two years.  They have a 5-year old son.  Her husband works in a textile business on the morning shift.  When we visited, we found them sewing in their house which is located in Villa Ingenio del Alto area.  They sell every two weeks in a town located in Desaguadero on the border of Peru.  This business is their main source of income and they are requesting financing to buy a double-needle industrial sewing machine so they can cover their orders.  That way they will have a higher income to live better.

loans.use: to buy a double-needle sewing machine

loans.name: Vicenta Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta  tiene como actividad la venta de comida, actividad que desarrolla solo los fines de semana, solo los días domingos, preparando lechón y pollo al horno esta actividad la desarrolla conjuntamente con su hijos y su esposo quienes le ayudan en esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para la compra de una maquina espiadera para pollos y así de esta manera aumentar su productividad y poder ampliar su  snack, la Sra. realiza muy ricos sus platos y es muy conocida por el lugar por la buena atención que brinda a su clientes, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Vicenta’s activity is food sales, an activity she does only on weekends, specifically on Sundays. She prepares roasted piglet and roasted chicken. Her children and husband help her with this activity. The loan will be used to buy a chicken rotisserie to increase production and be able to expand her snack bar.

She makes very delicious dishes and is well known in the place for the good service she provides her customers. She’s a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy a chicken rotisserie.

loans.name: Toribia Susana

texts.es: La señora Toribia es cliente nueva en la institución vive en la zona de las lomas se dedica al barnizado, afinado y acabado de sillas su taller esta en el mismo domicilio vive con sus hijos y su esposo que se dedica  a la carpintería  realiza puertas  y closets para cocina el crédito esta destina  a la compra de madera aglomerado y materiales para el afinado y acabado de muebles vive en casa propia a medio construir. Mas adelante tienen planificado realizar la construcción de su vivienda y así brindar mas comodidad a su familia, Trabaja toda la familia, apoyándose juntos en la fabricación y comercialización de muebles, con el tiempo desea tener un taller mas grande y así poder emplear mano de obra ya que otros jóvenes también aprendan el oficio de la carpintería.
texts.en:
Toribia is a new loan client. She lives in Las Lomas zone and works in carpentry, mostly varnishing, detailing and finishing chairs. Her workshop is located in a room in the house where she lives with her children and husband, who also works in carpentry making doors and kitchen cabinets. 

This loan will be used to buy wood composite boards and furniture making supplies. The family owns their home, which is still under construction. They hope to finish construction in the near future so that the family can live comfortably. Everyone in the family works making and selling furniture. They hope to expand the workshop in the future and be able to take on hired help and apprentices who would like to learn the trade.

loans.use: Purchase of wood, wood composite boards, and carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Azucena Altagracia

texts.es: Doña Azucena tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo en la aldea Corinto y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo de 6am a 8pm, utilizara el credito para la compra de abarroteria, lacteos, embutidos y granos basicos, desea surtir su negocio para la epoca de navidad. Su meta es tener una buena pulperia en donde venda de todo.
texts.en: Azucena is 45 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Corinto.  She works selling products for daily consumption.  She has a small grocery store in a room of her house.  Her business is open Monday through Sunday from 6am until 8pm.  She will use her loan to buy various grocery items, milk, sausages and basic grains.  She hopes to supply her business for the Christmas season.  Her goal is to have a good general store that sells a bit of everything.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items, milk, sausages and basic grains.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 71 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan y rosquillas, tambien vende leche, tiene ganado de ordeño, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de sus panes y rosquillas, en estos momentos los pedidos de los clientes han aumentado y no logra cubrir con todo, necesita tener una mayor produccion.
  Con la venta de la leche le va bien, tiene una buena cria de ganado.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is a 71-year-old single woman who makes and sells bread and ring-shaped pastry for a living. She also sells milk and has livestock to produce milk.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of materials to make bread and ring-shaped pastry.

Now, her customers' orders have increased and she is not able to meet their demands because she needs to increase production.

The sale of milk is doing well and she has good livestock breeds. She needs profits to pay family expenses.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, butter, sugar, margarine, oil, cheese, yeast, baking powder and firewood.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es:
Doña Lili sigue en el comercio de venta de ropa variada de adulto y niños a si como zapatos, ropa interior, manteniendo a sus clientes sastifecho, el cual ha venido surtiendo sus ventas a traves de los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado.
Es madre soltera de tres hijos, casados e independientes, en donde se apoyan para el bienestar de la familia. Hoy con este nuevo prestamo  invertira en mas ropa interior y trajes de niña y niños, asi como compras de encargos de los clientes, siendo las venta alta en este fin de año. Obteniendo mejores ganancias para sus gastos basicos como personales.
texts.en:
Lili is continuing with her business selling clothes of various kinds for children and adults, including shoes and underwear. She is keeping her customers satisfied, and she has been increasing her stock and her sales thanks to the loans granted to her by Afodenic.

She is a single mother of three children, who are married and independent, and they help each other for the well-being of the family. Now, with this new loan, she will invest in more underwear and boys' and girls' outfits, as well as purchases in response to customer orders, since the end of the year is a high season for sales. In this way, she will obtain higher earnings to cover her basic and personal expenses.

loans.use: to invest in underwear and children's clothing to increase her sales.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, Josefina se dedica a la ganaderia, vende leche, una parte de la leche que saca diario la utiliza para producir queso para venderlo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pasto para el gando y repuestos para reparar dos motocicletas que son el medio para transportar la leche.
doña Josefina es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Josefina is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  Josefina raises livestock, sells milk, and part of the milk that she collects daily she utilizes to produce cheese to sell.  She will use her loan to purchase hay for her cattle and parts to repair two motorcycles that are the means of transport for the milk.  Josefina is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She needs the earnings from her business to cover the expenses of her children.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle parts and hay for cattle.

loans.name: Alba Carolina

texts.es:
Alba Carolina tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres y tiene una hija, es madre soltera, Alba Carolina se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y sandalias, su negocio esta bien ubicado, esta en una zona en donde transitan muchas personas,  muy temprano se traslada en su bicicleta a abrir su negocio, sus ventas son de lunes a sabado y algunas veces los domingos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y sandalias, desea surtir el negocio ya que se aproxima la navidad y desea aprovechar dicha epoca para vender un poco mas y asi obtener mejores ganancias, las cuales necesita para curbrir los gastos de su hija.
texts.en:
Alba Carolina is 28 years old and lives at home with her parents.  She has one daughter and is a single mother.  Alba Carolina works selling new clothes and sandals.  Her business is in a good location, in an area where a lot of people pass through.  Very early she travels by bike to open her business.  The store is open from Monday through Saturday, and sometimes on Sundays.

She will use her loan to buy clothing and sandals.  She hopes to stock her business since the Christmas season approaches and she wants to take advantage of that period to sell a bit more and thus obtain better earnings.  She needs her earnings to cover the expenses of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sandals

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza sigue en el trabajo de la costura, a si como la venta de golosinas, hielo, helados. Su esposo laborando siempre de albañil y sus hijos casados.
Esperanza su ahnelo ha sido la mejora a su vivienda, en donde, con financiamiento ha logrado avanzar a largo plazo, con el credito anterior logro mejorar el baño y la compra de inodoro, teniendo una mejor higiene. Ahora con este nuevo credito podra hacer un bajarete de zinc en frente de su casa, y asi disminuir el sol en tiempo de verano como la lluvia. Para esto comprara laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, cemento, arena , entre otros materiales para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Esperanza continues her sewing work and selling sweets, ice, and ice cream.  Her husband works always as a bricklayer.  Their children are married.

Esperanza has always yearned to improve her house.  That is where, with financing, she has managed to make progress in the long term.  With her previous loan she managed to improve the bathroom and buy a toilet.  They now have better hygiene.

Now, with this new loan, she will be able to build a covered porch made from zinc in front of her house.  This will diminish the sun in the summer as well as the rain.  In order to do so she will buy corrugated metal roofing, roofing beams, bolts, cement, sand, and other materials to start the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a covered porch in front of her house.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sonia tiene 46 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, doña Sonia es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, todo los dias se levanta temprano para abrir su negocio y atender a sus clientes, Sonia se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar ropa nueva, desea surtir su negocio para la epoca de navidad.
Doña Sonia todos los dias le pide a Dios que ayude a su familia en todo lo que ellos hacen.
texts.en: Sonia is 46 years old, is married and has three children.  Sonia is a woman who works very hard to get ahead.  Every day she gets up early in order to open her business and serve her clients.  Sonia works selling new clothes for women, men and children.  She will use her loan to buy new clothing.  She hopes to supply her business for the Christmas season.  Every day Sonia asks God to help her family in everything they do.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Daysi Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Daysi tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive solo con su hijo. doña Daysi es una mujer con muchos deseos de superacion y lucha todos los dias para salir adelante con su hijo.
Daysi se dedica a la de venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y  niños. todos los dias se levanta temprano para abrir su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva, sus clientes le estan haciendo muchos pedidos y no tiene el capital para comprar la mercaderia.
Su unico deseo en esta epoca de navidad es que reine la paz y el amor, pues que esto prevalezca en los corazones de sus clientes, amigos y demas personas.
texts.en:
Daysi, age 34, is a single mother; and she lives with her son.  Daysi is a woman with a lot of desire for self-improvement.  She struggles every day in order to get her son ahead.

Daysi sells new clothes for women, men, and children.  She gets up early every day in order to open her business.

She will use the loan to buy new clothes.  Her customers are giving her a lot of orders, and she does not have the capital to buy the merchandise.

Her only wish during this Christmas season if for peace and love to reign.  This prevails in the hearts of her customers, friends, and other people.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
La señora Laureana, de 60 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 46, 41 y 31 años de edad,  vive en una Colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula con su madre y dos sobrinos.
Doña Laureana, tiene 30 años de dedicarse al comercio de venta de ropa, zapatos, sandalias, ropa casual y ropa interior.  Anteriormente vendía dulces y golosinas. Del actual negocio ella ha logrado pagar su vivienda y esta muy satisfecha de tenerlo.
Con el fin de tener una estabilidad económica ha solicitado varios prestamos a ODEF este de L.13,500.00 es el treceavo préstamo y lo va invertir en el negocio para surtir el inventario en ropa, zapatos, sandalias, ropa casual y ropa interior. Su meta sigue siendo mantener un nivel de ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida a nivel familiar.
texts.en:
Laureana, 60, is a single mother; she has three children who are 46, 41 and 31 years old.  She lives in one of San Pedro Sula’s outlying neighborhood with her mother and two nephews.

Laureana has been selling clothes, shoes, sandals, casual attire and underwear for 30 years.  She used to sell candy and snacks.  From her current business she’s managed to pay for her house and she’s very satisfied about having it.  

In order to have a more stable economy, she’s asked ODEF for a L.13,500.00 loan which is her 13th loan and she plans to use it to stock her store with clothes, shoes, sandals, casual attire and underwear.  Her goal is to continue to maintain a level of income that will permit a better quality of life at the family level.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

location.town: Colonia Reparto Lempira, San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married and has one son. She is an entrepreneur from the town of Skvira, where she sells groceries. She owns two vending locations at two different markets. Svitlana has been in this business for 5 years. She has one hired employee who works at one of her vending kiosks. Her average net profit amounts to 4,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Svitlana is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and to stock one of her grocery kiosks with confectionery inventory for the upcoming holiday season. Svitlana is very enthusiastic about her venture and her business. She invests all her energy in her business and seeks its growth.

loans.use: to stock one of her kiosks with additional merchandise.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She sells small home products such as tea pots, table lights, batteries for clocks, etc. Her business has three locations in a small open market near a factory. The factory workers can buy what they need after work. Since Irina sells inexpensive items, she has clients nearly all the time. Irina has many repeat clients, and a wise discount policy. 

Irina would like to borrow 15,000 Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) to purchase new inventory for her business. Irina has used micro loans in the past and considers them very helpful for her business development.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory.

loans.name: Miriam Geoconda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, ella tiene  41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 14 años de edad, ambos  estudian en Universidad  y colegio. Su esposo es microempresario.

Ella junto a su esposo y sus hijos tienen una lubricadora en el centro de la ciudad, allí ellos trabajan todos los días en lo que es limpieza y arreglos de automóviles, además de realizar estos trabajos ellos también venden ciertos repuestos de automóviles, filtros, aceites, entre otras cosas, mientas su esposo se encarga de los trabajos ella se dedica a la venta de estos repuestos. Llevan 15 años en este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar aceites, filtros y partes de automotores. Lleva más de 2  años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos. 

Sus sueños ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 community bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijon (Manta) canton, a place known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the hardworking people who live here work in the fishing industry.

This is where we meet Miriam. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children, ages 19 and 14. Both are students, one in college and one in high school. Miriam's husband is a small business owner.

Miriam and her family own an auto maintenance garage in the city center, where everyone works cleaning and repairing automobiles. They also sell spare parts, filters, and oil, among other things. Miriam's husband manages auto repair and maintenance services and Miriam is in charge of spare parts sales. The business is 15 years old and doing well.

This loan will be used to purchase oil, filters and spare auto parts. Miriam has been a member of this community bank for more than two years and is happy with its services because the interest rate is very low. Her dream is to expand her business and to see her children achieve professional careers.

loans.use: To buy oil, filters and automotive parts.

loans.name: Gina Susana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gina, ella tiene  44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y de 11 años de edad que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescado, tiene dos lanchas las cuales son tripuladas por dos o tres personas que ganan un buen porcentaje por la pesca que logren hacer,  estas personas se van a alta mar y se desplazan a la par de un barco pesquero el mismo que es tripulado por su esposo, ellos entregan el pescado en este barco y reciben el pago por el mismo, se van por 20 a 25 días seguidos y después de este tiempo regresan  a sus hogares para luego de una semana de descanso volver a alta mar. Ella tiene sus lanchas ya por 9 años y le va muy bien. 

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, combustibles y alimentos, elementos indispensables para obtener una buena pesca. Lleva 9 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado. 

Su sueño es comprar un barco más grande.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 communal bank meets in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton every two weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this lovely place.  Most of the inhabitants here are very hard-working and devoted to sea related work.

This is the place where we meet Gina, age 44.  She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 11.  The children go to school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She devotes herself to fishing and selling fish.

She has two boats that are manned by two or three people who earn a good percentage of the fish they catch.  These people go to the high sea and move level with the fishing boat that her husband mans.  They deliver the fish to this boat and receive their pay for the fish.

They go for 20 to 25 days in a row.  After that time, they return to their homes for a week of rest before returning to the open sea.  She has had her boats for nine years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy nets, cords, hooks, clamps, fuel, and food.  These are indispensable in order to get a good catch.  

She has been in her communal bank for nine years.  She likes it because the loans have always helped her.

Her dream is to buy a bigger boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, cords, hooks, clamps, fuel, and food.

loans.name: Ledy Sirlendy

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ledy,  tiene  57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas aún vive en su casa. Su esposo ya no trabaja está enfermo.

Ella  tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, además también vende productos naturales los mismos que vende en su local y algunas veces sale a entregar ya que la mayoría de sus productos los realiza a través de pedidos,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan cuando están desocupados. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen y gracias a Dios les da lo necesario para salir adelante, tiene su negocio ya por 15 años y  le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y productos naturales. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede seguir adelante en su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe its coastline. Most of the inhabitants are very hard working people who are engaged in sea-related activities for a living.

This is where we met Ledy, who is 57, married, and from this relationship she has three children, all of whom are of legal age, and one daughter still lives in her house. Her husband no longer works because he is ill.

She owns a grocery store in her house, where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil and dishwashing liquid, among others. She also sells natural products at her store, and sometimes she delivers the products because she makes most of her products on a per order basis. She works every day from 6 AM through 8 PM, and sometimes even later. Her husband and daughter help her when they are available. Her business is their only source of income and thank God it has provided them with everything they need to get ahead.

She has had her business for 15 years and has done well. She will use this loan to provide her store with rice, sugar, oil, dishwashing liquid and natural products. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because the loans help her continue her business. Her goals are to continue her business and grow her store more and more each day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, dishwashing liquid and natural products.

loans.name: Eloisa Cristina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eloísa, ella tiene  48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y  uno de 16 años que estudia en colegio, sus hijos mayores estudian en universidad, todos aún viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. Trabaja todos los días y sus hijos también le ayudan con sus ventas en sus lugares de estudio, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Guayaquil y Huaquillas cada vez que necesita. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y  lo mas vende es ropa de mujer.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The community bank Honduras 2000 meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton, which is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this beautiful place.  The majority of the inhabitants are very hardworking and work with the sea.

In this place we meet Eloisa, who is 48 years old, married, and has three children, two who are adults, and one who is 16 years old and studies in high school.  Her older children study at the university and all of them live with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

In order to earn money herself and help with the household expenses, she works selling all types of clothing.  She sells from door to door and also sells from her house, where customers come to purchase her products.  She works every day and her children help her with the sales where they study.  She gives her customers credit and collects every eight days.  She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil and Huaquillas whenever she needs it.  She has done this work for eight years and she sells the most women's clothing.

She will use this loan to purchase merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been a member of the community bank for eight years and she likes it because she used her first loan to start her business.  

Her dream is to have a car to make her sales.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Vicenta Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vicenta, ella tiene  63  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene ocho hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive  una hija la misma que ya es casada y vive junto a su familia, nuestra amiga está pasando por momentos muy tristes pues hace pocos días falleció su mamá quien también vivía en su casa. Su esposo es capitán de un barco pesquero.

Ella tiene un bus de transporte el cual es conducido por un chofer a quien le paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo. Además en su casa ella tiene un negocio de venta de bidones de agua, vende en su casa y también entrega a domicilio para lo cual también tiene una persona que es la encargada de realizar esta labor y a quien también le paga un sueldo mensual. Lleva cinco años con este negocio y más de 15 años con el bus de transporte.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar bidones de agua y ciertos repuestos para el bus. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 18 años ya que estaba en otro grupo y lleva 10 años  este banco. 

Su sueño es tener salud para ellos y los suyos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here most of the people are very hard workers working in maritime pursuits.

In this place we meet Vicenta. She is 63 years old, married and has 8 children. Her husband is the captain of a fishing boat. All of her children are older and independent. Her daughter is married and she and her family live with Vicenta. Our friend is passing some very sad moments because a few days ago her mother, who was also living in her home, died.
