She has a bus for transportation which is driven by a driver and she pays him a weekly salary for his work. Also in her house she has a business selling large containers of water; she sells at home and also offers home deliveries and she pays a person who is charge of this work a monthly salary. She has been in this business for 5 years and in the bus transport business for more than 15 years.

She is going to use the money from this loan to buy containers of water and some spare parts for the bus. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 18 years, at first a member of a different group, but has been with this communal bank for more than 10 years.

Her dream is for her and her family to stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the bus and large containers of water

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, ella tiene  43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas aún vive en su casa ya que es soltera. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de productos de bazar, ropa y papelería, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  ella en su tienda vende todos sus productos pero a veces también sale a entregar más que todo la ropa la misma que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva en este negocio por más de 5 años y nos comenta que desde que está recibiendo los créditos se le ha hecho más fácil poder surtir su local.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, ropa, productos de bazar y papelería. Lleva 11 años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le  da el banco, con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños es seguir adelante, comprar un carro y una lancha más grande para su esposo.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton (Manta). This place is known for the beautiful beaches that line its coast. Most of its in inhabitants are very hard working and dedicated to work related to the sea.

Here, we meet Señora María. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children from this marriage. One of her daughters still lives in her home since she is single. Her husband is a fisherman.

María has a general store in her house. There, she sells products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, and detergents, in addition to educational materials, clothing, and stationary, among other things. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., and sometimes much later. She sells all the products in her shop, but sometimes leaves to deliver, mainly clothing that she sells on credit. She collects the payments every 8 days. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and tells us that receiving loans has made it easier to be able to stock her shop.

This loan is going to be used to buy inventory for her shop. She is going to buy rice, sugar, clothing, educational materials, and stationary. She has been with the communal bank for 11 years. She likes it because of the help the bank gave her with one of the loans that began her business. Her dreams are to continue progressing, to purchase a car, and to buy a bigger boat for her husband.

loans.use: to buy  rice, sugar, clothing, educational materials, and stationary.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene  53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos todos mayores de edad, cinco de ellos aún viven en su casa y uno de ellos  estudian en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ella está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. 

Ella para ganar sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su familia hace dos años atrás puso un bar en su casa, luego de unos mese también adecuo otro local en el cual puso un bazar. En el bar vende bocadillos, jugos y batidos de frutas y en el bazar vende ropa, zapatos,  peluches y varios productos más, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta un poquito más tarde sobre todo los fines de semana,  ella trabaja con la ayuda de su hija.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su bazar, más que todo comprar ropa de todo tipo ya que en esta época es lo que más se vende.
 
Su sueño es que sus negocios sigan mejorando con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The "Honduras 2000" communal bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this lovely area. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and dedicated to the work of the sea. 

In this place, we meet María, who is 53 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has seven children, all of them grown. Five of them still live in her home, and one is studying at the university. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been a member of the communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the benefits she receives from the institution.  

To earn her own resources and thus help her family, two years ago she set up a bar in her home. After a few months, she also set up another shop, in which she opened a bazaar (general store). In the bar, she sells snacks, juices and fruit shakes, and in the general store she sells clothing, shoes, stuffed animals and various other products. She works every day from 8:00 to 6:00, and sometimes a bit later, above all on weekends. Her daughter helps her with her work. 

She will use the loan to stock her general store with more products; above all, she will buy clothing of all kinds, since it is the most popular product in this season. 

Her dream is that her businesses will continue to improve day by day.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Asuncion

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta su grupo porque es muy ordenado y cumplido, tiene 50 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció, pero  de esa relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad,  dos  de ellos aún viven en su casa ya que aún están solteros.

Ella para poder solventar  los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones y zapatos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería la compra en Santo Domingo,  en Quito o en Guayaquil depende de donde consiga más barato. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, zapatos, sabanas y edredones.

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su negocio siga adelante.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 cooperative bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta).  The area is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Here, the majority of the residents are very hard working and dedicated to work related to the sea.

María is a founding member of the cooperative, and she likes her group because it’s very organized and punctual.  She is 50 years old and lost her husband several years ago.  However she has five children that are now grown from this relationship.  Two of them live with her because they are still single.

In order to meet the household expenses, she dedicates herself to commerce.  She sells all types of clothing, sheets, comforters, and shoes.  She sells door-to-door, and also from her house where her customers arrive.  She works every day, extending credit to her customers and collecting payment every 8 days.  She buys her merchandise in Santo Domingo, in Quito or in Guayaquil, depending on where she can obtain lower prices.  She has been carrying out this activity for 15 years, and things are going very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as:  clothing, shoes, sheets and comforters. 

Her dreams are to have good health and for her business to continue moving forward.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Blanca Nieve

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene  50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo siete hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, tres  son mayores de edad y dos chicas de 16 y 13 años que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos  aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de útiles escolares, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, sus clientes le realizan muchos pedidos y ella tiene que tenerlos para cuando ellos llegan de sus faenas en el mar. Trabaja cuatro días de la semana, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería comprar en Manta o en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, ella lleva cinco años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas y ropa interior. Lleva más de 11 años en el  Banco Comunal le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local comercial
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 cooperative bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta).  The area is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Here, the majority of the residents are very hard working and dedicated to work related to the sea.

In this place we meet Blanca, who is 50 years old and married.  She had seven children from this relationship, however two have passed away.  Three are grown, and she has two girls aged 16 and 13, who are students.  All her children still live in her house.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She dedicates herself to selling clothing and all types of school supplies.  She sells door-to-door, and also from her house where her customers visit.  They place many orders, and she must have them ready when they return from their various jobs on the ocean.  She works four days per week, delivering on credit and collecting payment every fifteen days.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or Guayaquil each time she needs it.  She has been in business for five years, and things are going very well.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses and undergarments.  She has been with the cooperative bank for more than 11 years.  She likes it because, thanks to one of the loans, she was able to start her business.

Her dream is to have a commercial location.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses and undergarments.

loans.name: Angela Santos

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Ángela es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en él ha recibido mucha ayuda y alegrías ya que se entretienen cada reunión del banco, tiene  66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 16 hijos, todos mayores de edad,  pero dos hijas que están solteras aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que nunca se ha cansado de trabajar, trabaja en una empresa de sardinas de la localidad lugar en el cual lleva más de 30 años, pero además de esto en su casa tiene un bar en el cual vende bocadillos y bebidas como jugos naturales, batidos de fruta, energizantes, entre otras cosas, allí en este negocio le ayudan sus hijas, con las que trabaja todos los días  desde las 18h00 hasta las 22h00 ya que en la empresa trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 a 16h00, ella lleva más de 11 años con su negocio y le va muy bien, empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres, frutas y energizantes.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here most of the people are very hard workers involved in maritime pursuits.

Angela is a founding member of the Community Bank and she likes it because she has received a lot of help and happiness as they have fun at each meeting. She is 66 years old, married and has 16 children. All of them are adults but she has two unmarried daughters living in her home. Her husband is a fisherman. 

She is a fighting woman who has never tired of work. She has been working in a sardine company in her hometown for more than 30 years, but besides this she has a stand where she sells snacks and drinks such as natural juices, smoothies, energy drinks, and other things. Her daughters help her with this business. She works every day from 6:00PM until 10:00PM in her stand and she works Monday through Friday from 8:00AM until 4:00PM at the sardine company. She has been in business for 11 years and things are going very well. She began her business with the first loan that she received from the communal bank.

She will use the money from this loan to buy groceries, fruits, and energy drinks.

Her dreams are to have good health and to carry on.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruit, and energy drinks

loans.name: Gema María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Gema, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de 2 años de edad. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta zapatos, zapatillas y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa a clientes que llegan a adquirir alguna prenda o producto, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 2 años con su negocio y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y ropa de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, ropa y productos Yanbal. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios que les da el banco.

Su sueño es tener un local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here most of the people are very hard workers involved in maritime pursuits.

In this place lives Gema, who is 21 years old and lives in a consensual union (or common law) and she has a 2 year old daughter. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a very good wife and housewife who also works selling shoes, slippers and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories). She works 3 days of the week, selling door to door and also sells from her home to customers that come to buy an outfit or products. She leaves her products on credit and then collects payment every 8 days. She has been in this business for 2 years and things are going very well. Her best sellers are perfumes and women’s clothing.

This loan is to buy shoes, clothing and Yanbal products. This is her 4th loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits that the bank offers.

Her dream is to have a facility where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and Yanbal products

loans.name: Carmen Paula

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene  51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en la pesca, él junto a dos  personas más a quienes les pagan un sueldo se van a alta mar y se desplazan a la par de un barco pesquero a cual les  entregan el pescado fruto de su trabajo diario, en este barco entregan sus productos  y reciben el pago por el mismo, ellos se van por 20 a 25 días seguidos y después de este tiempo regresan  a sus hogares para luego de una semana de descanso volver a alta mar. El se dedica a este negocio desde pequeño y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que siempre obtienen buena pesca.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, combustibles, alimentos, y otros materiales de pesca. Lleva 10 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con  los créditos puede ser útil y colaborar con algo en los gastos del hogar. 

Su sueño es comprar otra lancha.
texts.en:
The communal bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (near Manta). This area is known for its beautiful beaches, which bathe the coasts of this beautiful place. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and are dedicated to the tasks of the sea.

In this place we meet Señora Carmen. She is 51 years old. She is married and from her marriage has five children, all of whom are adults. Two still live in her home. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a very good spouse who is obtaining the loan so that her husband can use it in fishing. He, along with two other people to whom they pay a salary, go out on the high seas. They tie up next to another fishing boat to which they hand over their catch, the fruit of their daily labor. On this boat, they hand over their catch and receive payment for the same. They go out for 20 to 25 days at a time and after this time they come back to their homes. After a week of rest, they return to the high sea. He has been working at this business since he was young, and it has always gone well for him, since they always get a good catch.

This loan is to buy nets, tethering ropes, fishing hooks, grappling hooks, fuel, food, and other materials for fishing. She has been in the communal bank for 10 years, and she likes it because with the loans she can be useful and contribute something to the household expenses.

Her dream is to buy another boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, tethering ropes, fish hooks, grappling hooks, fuel, food, and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Jenny Jaqueline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene  42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 9 años, la menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedicaba a la pesca pero ya no trabaja porque sus hijos son los que tripulan la lancha.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja cuatro  días de la semana y su hija le ayuda con las ventas, ella aprovecha para vender cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar ya que vienen con buenos recursos económicos y es cuando más fácil le resulta realizar sus ventas, ella  deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra cada quince días o deja en dos partes una al inicio y otra cuando regresen de sus labores de pesca a los 15 días. Su mercadería compra en Manta cada vez que necesita, lleva tres años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas y ropa interior. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.

Sus sueños son seguir con su negocio y salud para toda su familia.
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 meets every 2 weeks in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coasts of this beautiful place. Here most of the people work in maritime pursuits.

In this place we meet Jenny. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 are adults and the 2 younger ones are 16 and 9 years old. The youngest is a school student. Her husband is a fisherman but does not work because his children crew the boat.

She works selling all types of clothing. She sells door to door and also sells to her clients who come to her home. She works 4 days of the week and her daughter helps her with the sales. She takes advantage of the opportunity of selling when the fishermen return from the open sea as they have good financial resources and it is when it is the easiest to make sales. She leaves her products on credit and collects every fifteen days or in two parts, one initial payment and the other when the fishermen return from two weeks at sea.

She buys her merchandise in Manta each time it is necessary. She has been in the business for three years and is doing very well.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses and underwear. 

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because thanks to one of the loans she began her business.

Her dreams are to continue with her business and health for all her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear

loans.name: María Merida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, ella tiene  41años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos tres mayores de edad y el menor de 11 años el cual estudia en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, productos de bazar, ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y papelería entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, en su negocio se entretiene con sus amistades y conocidos que llegan todos los días  hasta su local. Lo que es ropa y zapatos los compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, tiene en su negocio ya por 5 años y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres, ropa y zapatos. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The "Honduras 2000" communal bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this lovely area. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and dedicated to the work of the sea.

In this place we meet María, who is 41 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has four children. Three are grown, and the youngest, age 11, is in school. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

She has a general store in her home, where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, bazaar-type products, clothing of all types, shoes, and paper goods, among other items. She works every day from 6:00 to 8:00, and sometimes later. While working in her business, she enjoys talking to friends and acquaintances who stop by her store each day. She buys the clothing and shoes in Guayaquil when she needs them. She has operated her business for 5 years already, and it has gone well for her. 

She will use this loan to stock her store with more items. She will buy groceries, clothing and shoes. She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans. 

Her goals are to keep going with her business and to see her store grow day by day.

loans.use: to buy groceries, clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi-Amman, Jordan, and is a mother of three children.
Eman is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase blankets, accessories and make-up for trading purposes. Eman aspires to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, accessories and make-up for trading purposes.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 21-year-old lady from Al Hashmi-Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase blankets for trading purposes.
Eman is looking to improve her family's living conditions as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Ms Mai is 41 years old with two childen who are school age. She has run a small grocery shop for ten years. In 2007, she became a client of the SEDA credit program. All of her previous loans were to invest in developing her shop. Currently, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Ms Hai is 49 years old with three children who are school age. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising poultry. She participated in the SEDA credit program in 2007 and used the loans for farming activity. Currently, she is raising chickens and oxen. For this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy food to feed her animals.

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Ms. Thua is 37 years old with four children who are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice, vegetables and is raising some pigs for meat. She joined SEDA’s credit program in 2007, and has used loans effectively toimprove the productivity of her agricultural production process. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivating.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivating

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Ms Anh is 28 years old with two small children. She has a shop that sells fresh pork in the local market. She has run this business for 5 years and created a good income for her to manage her family life. Joining Seda’s credit progam in 2007, she has used previous loans for expanding her shop. For this new loan cycle, she is in need of a loan for 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more pigs as raw fresh products.

loans.use: to buy more pigs as raw fresh products.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Ms Minh is 44 years old with two children who are in high school. She is managing a small grocery shop which was set up 5 years ago. This shop creates stable income for her family. Joining in SEDA's credit program in 2007, she used loans effectively in expanding her business. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Ms. Minh is 35 years old with 2 children who are school age. She is a farmer that focuses on growing vegetables for sale. Her business has been run for many years and it creates her main income. Joining SEDA’s credit program in 2007, she has used loans to buy seed, fertilizer and some other items to improve her productivity of cultivation. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to invest in her farming .

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Ms. Xuyen is 28 years old with 2 small children. She is a businesswoman who focuses on selling and buying scrap products. This business has been running  for 5 years and it creates the main income for her family. She also raises pigs for meat. Joining in our credit program since 2007, she has always been prompt in her loan repayment situation. She finds that the program is very suitable for her business. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (BND) to buy scrap products to expand her business and buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy scrap products to expand her business and buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en: Ms. Ngat is 35 years old with two children who are school age. She manages a shop that sells ready-made clothes. Her shop is running well with considerable revenue every month. She also raises chickens for meat.  Joining SEDA’s credit program in 2007, she used loans for expanding her shop.  At present, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more new designed clothes to meet the increasing demand of customers on Tet holiday. She will also use part of the loan for food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy more new designed clothes and food for her chickens.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en: Ms. Lieu is 42 years old with gso children who are school age. Being a farmer, she focuses on raising pigs and chickens for meat. This activity started 6 years ago. She has considerable income from this to manage her family life. Joining in our credit program, she hopes to have a loan of 5,152,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for poultry.

loans.use: to buy food for poultry.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Ms Hai is 28 years old with 2 small children. Being a pharmacist, she runs a medicine shop which started in 2009. He business creates 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) in profit per month. Joining in Seda’s credit program, she finds that this kind of credit is very suitable. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 6,944,000 VND to buy more medicine for her shop.

Ms Dao is 49 years old. She makes tofu to buy in retail. She wants to borrow a loan of 7,840,000 VND to buy beans to use as material.
Ms Ty is 56 years old. Shes sells bamboo. She wants to have a loan of 6,048,000 VND to buy bamboo.
Ms Hoa is 35 years old. She makes spring roll covers. She wants to have a loan of 6,496,000 VND to buy material.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for her shop.

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Ms Thanh is 66 years old with three children who are grown. She is a paper artificial goods maker - a traditional business in Vietnam. Her business started 2 years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2008, she has used loans for expanding her business activity. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,048,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy material for her making process.

Ms Thu is 52 years old. She has a shop that sells fresh fruit in local market. She wants to borrow a loan of 6,048,000 VND to buy more fruits for sale.

Ms Luong is 52 years old. She has a small wood work shop that make housing furniture. She wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy material for her making process.

loans.name: Barrio Florida Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el quinto ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2010. Todas las mujeres realizan actividades independientes como así también actividades en grupo para fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Nancy, ella tiene 3 hijos, esta acompañada con el Sr. Omar. Comenta que se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que siempre tiene mucha variedad de prendas, lo cual atrae a más clientes. Dice que desea seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, ya que desea comprar prendas de verano para poder estar abastecida para esta época que viene.
Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que se les da.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación arose through the contact of one of the members with the Foundation. Now the group is in its fifth loan cycle and has been working with the Foundation since 2010. All the women have independent business activities as well as activities in their group to promote good fellowship.

One of the members of the group is Señora Nancy. She has three children. Her partner is Sr. Omar. She comments that she has worked for several years selling clothing, which has gone very well for her, since she always has a great variety of items, which attracts more customers. She says that she wants to continue growing, and this is why she is applying for the loan, since she wants to buy summer clothing so that she will be stocked for the coming season. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for giving them the opportunity to progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Claudelina, que anteriormente se encontraba dentro de otro grupo pero por cuestiones tuvo que abandonarlo, decidió formar un grupo nuevo, con el cual se ha mantenido hasta. Ella comenta que se inspiro en la idea de producir un bien para ellas y sus familias.
Claudelina se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que siempre tiene mucha variedad, lo cual le ayuda a atraer a los clientes. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y generar los ingresos necesarios.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Agradece a la fundación y kiva por la oportunidad que les da, ya que es una ayuda importante.
texts.en:
This community bank was formed thanks to Señora Claudelina, who in the past was part of another group but had to leave it because of some problems. She decided to form a new group, which she is still a part of. She comments that she was inspired by the idea of producing a benefit for them (her fellow bank members) and their families.

Claudelina sells clothing of all types, and this business has gone very well for her, since she always has a lot of variety, which helps her attract customers. Thanks to her work she has been able to help her family and generate the necessary income.

She is applying for the loan to buy clothing, with which she will be able to stock her business and fill the orders that she has. She is thankful to the Foundation and to Kiva for giving them this opportunity, since it is an important help.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está casada con el señor Adelio, tienen 3 hijos, una de ellas ya terminó sus estudios secundarios y dos de ellos están en la escuela aún. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de herrería hace ya como 10 años.
Teresa vivió hasta los 16 años en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, luego vino a Asunción en busca de trabajo y empezó en una casa de familia como empleada doméstica durante 9 años, más adelante se casó y tuvo a su primer bebé, y como no podía dejarla a nadie su cuidado, habló con una amiga y decidieron estudiar juntas la carrera de Corte y Confección, y de esa manera una vez recibidas iban a poder trabajar desde su casa.
Actualmente trabaja para una funeraria muy conocida en el país, en donde su trabajo consiste en confeccionar las prendas para revestir los ataúdes y las mortajas(vestimentas para los difuntos).
El crédito que retira es para ella un gran apoyo porque de esa manera puede adquirir para sus máquinas de coser, lo cual le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Teresa is from the city of Villa Elisa and is married to Adelio. They have three children, one of whom completed high school while the other two are still in school. Her husband has worked in a blacksmith shop for the past ten years.

Teresa lived in the city of Coronel Oviedo until she was 16 years old. She then went to Asunción in search of a job and she worked at a family’s house as a maid for nine years. Later, she married and had her first child. Since she had to care for her baby, she spoke with a friend and they decided to study tailoring together so that they could work from home once they completed their studies.

Teresa currently works at a well-known funeral home in Paraguay where she makes garments to cover the coffins as well as the deceased. The loan is of great help to her because she can use it to purchase sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La señora Pablina tiene 53 años de edad, es Soltera, comenta que no tiene hijos. La familia de Pablina vive en la ciudad de Caacupé y cuente que tiene en su domicilio un copetín desde hace 4años.
La señora Pablina trabaja mucho y más en este tiempo cuando van llegando las fiestas de fin de año, donde las ventas de comestibles y bebidas  aumentan considerablemente. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por darle a su familia todo lo mejor y de esa forma retribuirles lo que han hecho por ella.
La Cliente agradece a Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y con el crédito que pide desea comprar carnes, condimentos, panificados y demás ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que prepara.
texts.en:
Pablina is 53 years old, single, and says that she has no children. Pablina’s family lives in the city of Caacupé and she says that she has had a snack shop in her house for the past four years.

Pablina works a lot, especially now that the holidays are almost here when food and beverage sales increase considerably. She considers herself to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman who struggles to provide her family with all the best and thus repay them for everything they have done for her.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support provided to her business. With this loan requested, she would like to buy meat, condiments, bread products and other ingredients needed to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, bread products and other items.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la Ciudad de Itá , aun vive en el terreno familiar pero con casa y actividad propia, se independizó y posee su propio taller de confecciones ,posee dos maquinas rectas industriales y una overlock de 5 hilos.
El se define como un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, que lucha por un futuro mejor, ya que pese a su corta edad desea salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y también en los gastos de la casa. Quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio por lo que desea poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierre y demás insumos con los cuales podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Marcos is 19 years old, single, and lives in the city of Itá. He still lives on his family’s property, but in his own house and has his own business. He became independent and has his own tailoring shop, where he has two industrial machines and a 5-thread overlock sewing machine.

He considers himself to be a very hardworking and enterprising young man who fights for a better future. Despite his young age, he wants to get ahead so that he can help his family and contribute to the household expenses. He wants his business to continue to grow, which is why he wants to be able to continue investing in it.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies to meet his customers’ demands. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity provided to him.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Don Rubén tiene 59 años de edad, está casado hace mas de 20 años con la Sra. Calixta de 52 años de edad, tienen juntos 3 hijos todos mayores de edad.
El señor Rubén es hijo de un agricultor, creció en una de las compañías de Carapeguá. Trabajó en el campo con su padre, a los 26 años de edad se casó con Sra. Calixta quien es hija de una tejedora y empezaron a trabajar juntos, hoy en día, desde hace mas de 20  años se dedica a la venta de las tradicionales  sobrecamas y hamacas que se producen en la ciudad de Carapeguá, los cuales lleva a vender por la zonas de Caaguazú y Ciudad del Este. Comentan que tienen una  clientela bien formada, incluso su señora quién es artesana es quien teje las frazadas y así obtiene  un menor costo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer hamacas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rubén is 59 years old and has been married to his 52-year-old wife, Calixta, for the past 20 years. Together, they have three children who are all adults.

Rubén is the son of a farmer and grew up in one of the companies in Carapeguá. He worked the field with his father and at 26, he married Calixta, who is the daughter of a weaver, and they began to work together. They have now been selling traditional bedspreads and hammocks made in the city of Carapeguá for more than 20 years, selling them in Caaguazú and Ciudad del Este. They have a well-established customer base and Calixta is an artisan and weaves the blankets, thereby reducing their cost.

Rubén is requesting the loan for the purchase of yarn and dye to weave hammocks which are in high demand during this season.

loans.use: to buy yarn and dye to weave.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis Group

texts.es:
El comité san francisco de Asís se formo gracias a la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Ybycui. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y muy emprendedoras que se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Mirtha, quien se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser cerdos, ella nos cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, puesto que tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales y velar por que no les falta nada, pero a pesar de eso le gusta lo que hace por que es un trabajo digno.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lechones para la cría y posterior venta. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The San Francisco de Asis Group was formed by several neighbors in the city of Ybycui that decided to unite. They are hardworking and very enterprising women who joined together in order to help one another to support their families.

One of the women in the group is Mirtha, who works raising animals such as pigs. She tells us that her work requires a great deal of sacrifice, as she always has to look out for her animals and make sure they have everything they need. Despite this, she enjoys what she does because it is a decent job.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of piglets to raise and later sell. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el décimo cuarto ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007. Todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras y lo han demostrado en todos los ciclos.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Elvira, ella tiene 3 hijos  esta acompañada con el Sr. Aldo, quien trabaja como empleado en una yerbatera y ella se dedica hace varios años al bordado. Cuenta la Sra. que por medio de este trabajo ella puede ayudar en la casa y de esa forma compartir los gastos con su marido para poder mantener a la familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y agujas para los bordados que hace, ya que esos son los insumos indispensables para su negocio.
texts.en:
This group in the city of Encarnación formed because of contact by one of its members with the Fundación,. The group is in its fourteenth loan cycle and has been working with the Fundación since 2007. All are very hardworking and enterprising women and they have demonstrated this in every cycle.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Elvira. She has three children and lives with Sr. Aldo, who is employed by an herbalist. She has done embroidery work for several years. She notes that with her work she can help support the family by sharing household expenses with her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase thread and needles for the embroidery she does, since these are indispensable supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela es de Ciudad del Este, está casada tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y bazar, en su domicilio, nos comenta que con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación, ya que ambos se esfuerzan por darle lo mejor a su familia.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato y a la buena calidad de los productos que vende. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, pues se acerca el calor y quiere abastecerse para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
Graciela is from Ciudad del Este and is married with two school-aged children. She works selling clothing and stationery items from her home. She says that with the help of her husband and with a great deal of sacrifice and dedication, they are getting ahead, as they both strive to provide the best for their family.

She is now a successful micro-entrepreneur with a large clientele as a result of her good service and the quality of the products she sells. She considers herself to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of summer clothing, as it will start to get warmer and she wants to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 44 years old. She is married and has 3 children ages 16, 13 and 10. In 2001, she established her cow's milk selling business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
La Sra. Érica está casada con Emilio, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 ya están casados y 2 aun están en la escuela primaria, viven en Ciudad del Este. Érica tiene una despensa bien surtida y de buena ubicación en el barrio ya que la parada de ómnibus de la zona está ubicada frente a su casa.
Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años. Hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y buenos precios, con una clientela formada. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable a sus compromisos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, hortalizas y demás productos para poder abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Érica is married to Emilio, with whom she has four children, two of which are already married and two are still in elementary school. They live in Ciudad del Este. Érica has a well-stocked store with a good location in the neighborhood, as the area bus stop is right in front of her house.

She started her business several years ago with little merchandise, which grew little by little over the years. She now has a well-stocked store and good prices, in addition to a well-established customer base. She is a very hardworking person and is responsible with her commitments.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of soft drinks, food, vegetables and other products to stock her business. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, food, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 34 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 13.  In 2002, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW.  She is using this loan to buy food materials for her business.  In the future, Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

(Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called chiya pasals, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.)

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
La Paz surgió gracias a la unión de varias vecinas de Ciudad del Este, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra con 17 integrantes, quienes están en el décimo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Todas ellas trabajan juntas para poder salir adelante.
Una de las miembros es la señora Juana, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Nos cuenta que gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y ayudarlos. Comenta que gracias a la buena sazón que tiene ha podido formarse una buena clientela y de esa forma salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, panificados, hortalizas y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The group "La Paz" came about as the result of a number of neighbors in Cuidad del Este getting together.  They are very hardworking women who have a strong desire to get ahead.  At this time, the group has 17 members who are in their 10th loan cycle in the Enterprising Women program of Fundación Paraguaya. They are all working together so that they can get ahead.

One of the members is Juana, who has a business selling food.  She tells us that thanks to her work she has been able to support her family and provide them with assistance.  She comments that thanks to the good flavor of her food she has been able to establish a good customer base, and in this way, get ahead.  She requests a loan to buy meat, bread products, vegetables and other supplies that she needs in order to make the food that she sells.  She thanks the Fundacion for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread products, vegetables and other supplies

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
La victoria es denominado el grupo formado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, son todas mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy emprendedoras. Se unieron con el propósito de trabajar en conjunto y por medio de ello salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la señora Cinthia, quien se dedica al reciclaje, ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas del día para recorrer por las calles y juntar los productos reciclables, dice que esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace por que es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos reciclables, para la reventa y de esa forma tener un margen de ganancia mejor. Ella agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
"La Victoria" is the name of this group that includes 16 women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They are all tenacious, hardworking and enterprising women.  They formed a group with the idea of working together so that they could get ahead and help their families. 

One of the members is Cinthia, who has a recycling business.  She comments that through her work she has been able to help her family and give them what they need.  She says that she sacrifices a lot for her work, since every day she must get up in the very early hours of the morning to go through the streets collecting recyclable products.  She says that she is very proud of what she does, because it is decent and honest work.  

She requests a loan to buy recyclable products to re-sell, and in this way have a better profit margin.  She is grateful to the Fundacion for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials to re-sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: This is 36 year-old Marie.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 18, 16, and 14. In 2005, Marie established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Marie has already received and successfully repaid loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more slippers for her store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Marie plans to further expand her business and to start traveling to Guinea for her slippers, and to also give her children quality education.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more slippers for her store

loans.name: Ashiatu

texts.en: This is 39 year-old Ashiatu.  She is married and has 4 children, aged 15, 12, 8, and 5 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her because he is her relative attending school in the city.  In 2010, Ashiatu established her plastic shoes business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and to be recognized in the community. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ashiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy rubber sandals, foam slippers, and two slim slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Ashiatu plans to have a bigger business, to educate her children, and to build a house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic slippers

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Activas se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjuntos, las cuales las ayudan a fomentar su compañerismo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades.
La Señora Silvina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas tiene un comedor donde da de comer a los obreros, es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Comenta que tiene muy buena sazón para las comidas, por lo que logró hacerse de una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, panificados, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que prepara.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Activas" was formed by a number of neighbors who joined together from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  Each member of this group has their own independent business, but the members also have activities that they work on together, which promote their camaraderie.  They are a very united group that is capable of carrying out its joint activities.

Silvina is one of the members of this group.  She has a business selling food.  She has an eatery where she provides food to the workers.  She is a very hardworking woman who has a strong desire to get ahead.  She comments that her food is very tasty, and because of this she has managed to develop a solid customer base.

She requests a loan to buy meat, vegetables, bread products, dairy products and other supplies that she needs in order to make the dishes that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bread products, dairy products and other supplies

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es: María Francisca de sesenta y ocho años de edad vive con su hija. Ella posee una pupuseria que es la que le ayuda a sostener los gastos del hogar, vende pupusas de frijoles, queso y chicharrón, es muy conocida en la localidad pues hace las pupusas más exquisitas, a un buen precio y con material de excelente calidad; María es una mujer emprendedora a pesar de su avanzada edad siempre está dispuesta a trabajar para salir adelante, piensa que al sembrar una idea, se cosecha un deseo y el suyo es hacer crecer su negocio ya tiene experiencia crediticia y es por eso que se animo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, frijoles, chicharrón, queso etc. María Francisca tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Francisca is 78 years old and lives with her daughter. She has a business selling pupusas [thick, hand-made corn tortillas stuffed with other ingredients], which helps her to keep up with the household expenses. She sells pupusas filled with beans, cheese and pork rinds. She is very well known in her locality because she makes the most exquisite pupusas, sells them at a good price, and uses ingredients of excellent quality. María is an enterprising woman who, despite her age, is always ready to work hard to get ahead. She believes that once you plant an idea you can harvest a wish, and hers is to expand her business. She already has borrowing experience so she is excited to request a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will let her buy corn wholesale, as well as beans, pork rinds, cheese, etc. María Francisca is confident that this will help her give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, as well as beans, pork rinds and cheese

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
El señor Secundino es de la ciudad de Pilar, está casado, es comerciante, tiene una empresa de transporte donde realiza fletes, y también tiene una tienda de venta de artículos de primera necesidad.
Comenta que hace 10 años se dedica a esto, por lo que ya pudo formarse una buen clientela, dice que le va muy bien, y que este trabajo es el medio por el cual ayuda a su familia y puede mantenerlos.
El se define como una persona trabajadora, emprendedora y luchadora, todo lo que hace es por su familia, ya que desea que ellos no pasen por necesidades. Quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar y demás insumos con lo cual podrá podrá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Secundino is from the city of Pilar and he is married. He has a transport company that hauls freight, and he is also a trader with a grocery store selling basic items.

He says he started this business 10 years ago, so he has been able to build up a good clientele. It is going very well he says, and it provides him with the means to help and support his family.

He describes himself as a hard-working and determined entrepreneur. Everything he does is for his family, because he doesn't want them to suffer hardship. He wants to keep growing his business, so he is requesting a loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar and other supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar and other supplies.

loans.name: Lorena Aracely

texts.es: Lorena Aracely de treinta y tres años de edad vive con sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, leche, pan entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, pues posee la tienda mas surtida del lugar, donde vende los productos de mas bajo precio y de excelente calidad además el servicio es inigualable Lorena se caracteriza por su amabilidad; es una mujer muy activa, trabaja muy duro desde que sale el sol, le gusta estar siempre delante de su competencia y satisfacer todas las necesidades del cliente, su lema es, cuando el hombre espera mover montañas, empieza siempre por mover pequeñas piedrecillas y Lorena quiere empezar por lo más pequeño es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, bebidas, aceites, productos de uso personal etc. Lorena Aracely tiene la esperanza que así lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena Aracely is 33 years old and lives with her three children in her own home. 

She has a store where she sells basic staples such as beans, rice, milk, and bread among other items. She has recently made lots of customers. She has a well supplied store, selling her stock at a good price and high quality and the service she offers is unmatched. Lorena is characterized by her friendliness.

She is a very active woman, working very hard, starting at dawn. She likes to stay ahead of the competition and satisfy the needs of her customers. Her motto is, when a man hopes to move mountains, he always begins by moving tiny stones, and Lorena wants to begin tiny, and this is why she is asking Integral for a loan in order to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, drinks, oils, personal use items, and other products. Lorena Aracely has the hope that in this way she could have financial security and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, drinks, oils, and personal use items

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní se unieron con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. La mayoría de ellas son jefas de familia, muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día se sacrifican. Ellas ven en el programa de la fundación una gran oportunidad de progreso y de ayuda para cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Zonia, quien gracias a la venta de ropa que realiza ha podido salir adelante y ayudar al sustento de la casa. Ella comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio ya que siempre tiene muy buenas prendas. El sueño de ella es poder seguir creciendo y llegar a convertirse en una gran comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que se acerca la época de calor y quiere abastecerse.
texts.en:
Thirteen women from the city of Santaní bonded together with hopes of getting ahead and helping their children and relatives. Most of them are the heads of their families, very hard working and fighters who make self sacrifices every day. They see in the communal bank program a great opportunity to progress and to help one another.

One of the members is Zonia, who, thanks to the sales from clothing, has been able to get ahead and help to provide the household expenses. She comments that she is doing well in her business and that she always has good clothes. Her dream is to be able to continue growing and to become a successful merchant. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy summer outfits, as the warm season is approaching and she wants to stock up.

loans.use: to buy summer outfits to sell later

loans.name: Eric .m

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Eric.  He is married, and has 4 children, aged 14, 7, 4 and 2 years. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him because he assists his wife doing domestic work.  In 2009, Eric established his provision and drinks business. He started this business to get income that he uses to provide a livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Eric has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy luncheon meat, butter, Peak milk, sardines, mayonnaise and Bond Street. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Eric plans to become a wholesaler, to embark on external and international trade and to send his children to a quality private school.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy luncheon meat, butter, Peak milk, sardines, mayonnaise and Bond Street

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo es soltero, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar. El se dedica a la venta de pescados que el mismo trae de las rivera del río Paraguay, se dedica a esto hace como 5 años, 
nos comenta que tiene todo lo que necesita para poder dedicarse a este trabajo.
Comenta que este trabajo lo ha ayudado a salir adelante y ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante y por progresar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de una congeladora, ya que le ayudará mucho en su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señor Hugo, age 31, is single. He lives in Pilar city and sells fish which he fishes himself from the Rio Paraguay's brooks. He has done this for approximately five years.
He tells us that he has everything he needs in order to do this work.
He also tells us that this job has helped him to help his family with the household costs and to get them ahead. He is a very hard-working person who has always taken pains to get ahead and succeed.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a freezer, which will help him greatly in his business. He thanks the Fundacion for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for selling fish.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Memuna.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 16,13 and 9 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lived with her because he is her husband’s nephew.  In 2007, Memuna established her timber business. She began her business because she wants to enhance her independence and that is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Memuna has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more timber for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Memuna plans to own a fleet of vehicles, to build her own a house and to educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy timber for her business

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 37 year-old Adama.  She is married and has four children ages 15, 12, 8 and 4 years old. In 2004, Adama established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because it is more profitable and in order to get a reliable source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more stock of plastic slippers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business, educate her children and own a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers for her business.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Primavera es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, quienes vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas trabajan mucho día a día para que de esa forma puedan salir adelante.
Una de las miembros es la señora Irma, quien se dedica a la lavandería. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y por lo mismo le va muy bien en el negocio. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que cada día se empeña para poder aumentar sus ganancias. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones, suavizantes para ropas y demás insumos necesarios para poder utilizar en su lavandería. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Primavera ["Spring"] is a group made up of eleven women from Curuguaty city. They are all friends and neighbours in Curuguaty, who saw the Fundacion Paraguaya's Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Female Entrepreneurs' Programme] as a great opportunity to get ahead. They work a lot day in and day out so that they can get ahead.
One of the group members is Señora Irma, who provides a laundry service. She says that she has many clients, so her business is going very well. She wants to be able to continue expanding, so she works hard every day to increase her income. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of laundry detergent and fabric softener, as well as other necessary products for her laundromat. She thanks the Fundacion for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy laundry detergent and fabric softener.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Mercedes está situado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, es un grupo del programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya actualmente se encuentran en el 3er ciclo, con 14 integrantes. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día se esfuerzan por darle lo mejor a sus hijos y familiares.
Un ejemplo de lucha es la señora Agustina, quien se dedica a la la venta de joyería, nos comenta que trabaja duro y siempre trata de tener los mejores productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Ella se define como una persona emprendedora y quien no teme a ningún tipo de trabajo. Su sueño es poder montar su propia joyeria donde tendrá más ganancias.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de anillos, cadenas, pulseras y demás tipos de joyas, lo cual la ayudará a tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Maria Mercedes communal bank is located in Curuguaty city. It is a member group of the Fundacion Paraguaya's Comité de Mujeres Rurales [Rural Women's Communal Bank] programme. They are currently in their third cycle with 14 members. These are very hard-working women who struggle day in and day out in order to give their children and families the best.
Señora Agustina is a prime example of one of these hard-working women. She sells jewelry, and tells us that  she works hard and always tries to have the best products to offer her customers. She is an enterprising woman who is not afraid to work. Her dream is to launch her own line of jewelry and have a greater income.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of rings, chains, bracelets and other kinds of jewelry. This will allow her to have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy rings, chains, bracelets and other kinds of jewelry.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El comité san rafael es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está integrado por 14 mujeres, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron gracias a su espíritu de lucha, ya que vieron en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación una gran oportunidad para salir delante y ayudar a sus familias.
Honoria es una de las miembros, quien dice que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, comenta que su despensa recibe a los clientes desde muy tempranas horas. Nos cuenta que su negocio le tare buenos ingresos por que la mayoría de sus vecinos compran de ella. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y tener una mayor ganancia para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con productos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, yerba y demás. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Rafael" is located in the city of Curuguaty and comprised of 14 women who are friends and neighbors there.  They formed a group because of their common fighting spirit since they saw that the Fundación offered a women's program and a great opportunity to get ahead so they could help their families.

Honoria is one of the members.  She says she begins work very early in the morning when she receives her first customers.  Her business provides a good income since most of her neighbors buy from her.  One of her goals is to keep growing and earn even more money to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to stock her store with essential goods such as sugar, pasta, rice, herbs and other items.  She is grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy pasta, rice, herbs and other items.

loans.name: Fredy Humberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Fredy, es conviviente y tiene 38 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos; el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos como detergentes,jabones entre otros productos,el distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que venden estos productos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos . El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como jabones,detergentes y desinfectantes al por mayor.
El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Mr. Fredy, 38, has a common-law wife and two children.  He sells consumer products such as detergents, soaps and other items which he distributes to the specialist stores.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and is able to provide for his children through his work.  He wants to expand business to sell more products.  He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale items such as soap, detergents and disinfectants.

He is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale soap, detergent and disinfectants.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité son en su mayoria cabezas de hogar en sintesis las que administran y se encargan de llevar a casa el pan del dia a día. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en su quinto ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de resposabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes.
Mirna es una de las miembros, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, quien por medio de su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y progresar en su negocio. Ella nos comenta que su negocio va muy bien, por lo que le trae muy buenos ingresos. Ella desea seguir creciendo, por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, por medio de un crédito.
Utilizará el crédito para abastecer su negocio con prendas de todo tipo para cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of this communal bank are mainly heads of household who manage the home and put bread on the table every day.  They are in their fifth cycle and stand out as a group because of each member's sense of responsibility and desire to get ahead.

Mirna, one of the members, sells all kinds of clothing for a living.  She defines herself as a hard-working person who has made an effort to get ahead and make her business successful.  She says business is going well and provides her with a good income.  She wants to continue to grow and is requesting a loan through the Fundación and Kiva that she will use to buy all types of clothing to fill customer orders.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Azucena Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras se han unido para poder formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Vieron en este programa, una gran oportunidad de crecimiento, no solo en lo económico sino ta,bien en lo personal. Están muy contentas y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Catalina, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de leche. Dice que empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano, para que así, a la hora del desayuno su producto ya se encuentre en las mesas de sus clientes. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, trabaja sin cansancio para de esa forma ayudar en la casa y a su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de leche en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda asegurar su producto esencial a los clientes.
texts.en:
A group of 15 hard-working, determined women got together to participate in the women entrepreneur program through the Fundación Paraguaya.  Thye saw in the program an opportunity for growth, not only economic but also personal.  They are very happy and want to go as far as the program will take them.

On of these women is Mrs. Catalina who sells milk.  She begins work very early in the morning so that her product is already on her customers' tables for breakfast.  She defines herself as a hard-working, determined woman who works tirelessly so she can help out at home and with her family.

She is requesting support from the Fundación and Kiva to buy large volumes of milk so she can make sure her customers have this essential product.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.
