loans.name: Rejuntadas Group

texts.es:
Rejuntadas es el grupo formado por 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí, quienes trabajan muy a gusto dentro del octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con las ganas de progresar y salir adelante, y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias, son mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Una de ellas es la señora Liz, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la cual se dedica a la costura desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Comenta que siempre esta con mucho trabajo, por lo cual no se queja, ya que ese es su medio de mantener a su familia. Ella desea poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Quiere comprar telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos necesarios para su taller. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que les da.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rejuntadas" is comprised of 17 women from the city of Paraguarí.  They are doing very well in their eighth cycle of the women entrepreneur program at the Fundación Paraguaya.  Being very hard workers, they formed the group because of their desire to get ahead and become successful so they could help their respective families.

One of them is Mrs. Liz who is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been in the sewing business for quite some time.  She says she always has a lot of work and cannot complain since this allows her to support her family.  With an aim toward filling customer orders she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other necessary supplies for her workshop.  She is grateful to the Fundación and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 46 años, está casado con Amelia, tienen 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Juan se dedica al macate(venta ambulante) hace más de 3 años, con la ayuda de su señora, cuenta con clientela formada y en lo cual le va muy bien gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, los cuales consisten en sabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas y demás.
Juan es una persona muy admirada por el gran sacrificio que demuestran por mejorar su calidad de vida, diariamente recorren varios kilómetros para ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo realizar sus cobranzas.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra desabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas para su negocio, ya que dese poder estar abastecido para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 46 years old, he is married to Amelia and they have two children who are grown up and independent. Juan has worked as a travelling salesman for more than 3 years with the help of wife. He relies on regular customers and it is going very well for him thanks to the good quality of his products, which consist of sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more.

Juan is much admired for the great sacrifice he is making in order to improve his quality of life. Every day he travels several kilometers to sell his products and cover his costs.

He plans to use the loan to buy sheets, blankets and bedspreads for his business as he would like to be well stocked in order to meet his customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets and bedspreads to sell on.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de servcios de llamadas telefonicas,ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia tambien vende productos naturales,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los servicios de llamadas y productos naturales . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y tambien para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is Señora Dolores. She is 47 years old, she lives with her partner and she has 4 children. The member is still working in her telephone call service business. She works as street vendor. The member works from 7:00 until 8:00 pm. She also sells natural products. Through these businesses the member is getting her children ahead in life. Her dream is to have a premises where she can sell her call services and natural products. The member is requesting the loan to buy cellular phones and also to buy natural products.

She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and also to buy natural products.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Noemi Luz, es casada y tiene 51 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ferreteria y tambien vende materiales de construccion como pinturas,clavos,yeso y arena,la socia sigue trabajando junto con su esposo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar sus negocios . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arena,pinturas,clavos,yeso y tornillos par que implemente su ferreteria y negocio de venta de materiales de construccion. 

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Señora Noemi Luz is married, she is 51 years old and she has 4 children. The member is still working in the hardware business and she also sells construction materials such as paint, nails, plaster and sand. The member is still working with her husband. Her dream is to expand and improve her businesses. The member is requesting the loan to buy sand, paint, nails, plaster and screws for her hardware store and business of selling construction materials.

The member appreciates and is grateful for the loan she has been granted and she promises to be disciplined in the repayment of her debts.

loans.use: to buy sand, paint, nails, plaster and screws for her hardware store and business of selling construction materials.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre El Progreso, debido a que el comite fue progresando con la fundacion, han asumido el compromiso de mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de responsabilidad, actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, integrado por 12 mujeres quienes invierten sus prestamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Julia, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de empanadas. Cuenta que siempre tiene mucha venta, lo cual la ayuda a tener mejores ingresos con lo que ayuda a su familia. Ella dice que uno de sus sueños es poder tener una casilla donde vender los productos que tiene.
Solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para poder comprar carnes, pollo, jamón y queso, huevo y condimentos, los cuales son indispensables para su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee goes by the name of El Progreso [Progress] due to the fact that the committee was making progress with the foundation. They have pledged to remain a united group and to work responsibly. They are currently in their sixth loan cycle. The members are made up of 12 women who invest their loans in their respective activities.

One of these women is Señora Julia who tells us that she sells empanadas for a living. She says that her sales are always high and this helps her to have a better income which supports her family. She says that one of her dreams is to have a stall where she can sell her products.

She is requesting help from the foundation and from kiva to purchase meat, chicken, ham and cheese, eggs and condiments which are essential to her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, ham and cheese, eggs and condiments.

loans.name: Gaby Alejandra

texts.es:
La Sra. Gaby, es soltera y tiene 22 años de edad, La socia es economista y se sigue dedicando al negocio de ferreteria que trabaja junto con su madre,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere terminar de hacer su tesis,el sueño de la socia es ser profesional. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los derechos de estudios para que pueda hacer su tesis.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Señora Gaby is single and she is 22 years old. She is an economist and she is still working in the hardware business with her mother. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. The member wants to finish writing her thesis. Her dream is to have a professional career. She is requesting the loan to pay her education fees so that she can do her thesis.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.
.

loans.use: to pay her education fees so that she can write her thesis.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria, es casada y tiene 29 años de edad, ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años; la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales y ahora tambien esta trabajando como cosmetologa haciendo cortes,teñidos y ondulaciones,ella trabaja en forma independiente,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda hacer los trabajos como cosmetologa y tambien vender los productos naturales . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos naturales y tambien para comprar materiales como tintes,ruleros y tijeras para su trabajo de cosmetologa.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Señora Victoria is married, she is 29 years old and she has 1 son, aged 7. The member still sells natural products for a living and now she is also working as a cosmetologist doing haircuts, dyes and waves. She works independently and through these small businesses she is getting her son ahead in life. Her dream is to have a premises where she can work as a cosmetologist and also sell natural products. The member is requesting the loan to buy natural products and also to buy materials such as dyes, curlers and scissors for her job as a cosmetologist.

The member values and is grateful for the loan granted to her and promises to be disciplined in the repayments of her debts.

loans.use: to buy natural products and also to buy materials such as dyes, curlers and scissors for her job as a cosmetologist.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar tiene 49 años, está casado con la  Sra. Eduarda de 59 años. Tienen 2 hijas de 23 y 17 años respectivamente.
El Sr. Edgar trabaja medio tiempo en una Asociación de Empleados y además tiene una pequeña librería y fotocopiadora que atiende desde el mediodía hasta la noche, en el mismo vende artículos de librería, realiza trabajos por computadora y fotocopias. También posee helados de diferentes sabores para la venta  en vasitos, cucuruchos y en potes de  distintas  medidas. El se define como un hombre dinámico que realiza todo tipo de cosas para poder ayudar a su familia.
El Sr. Edgar desea invertir el crédito en la compra de cuadernos, hojas de diferentes tamaños, carpetas archivadoras, cartulinas y otros artículos para poder abastecer su librería. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Señor Edgar is 49 years old and he is married to Señora Eduarda who is 59 years old. They have 2 children aged 23 and 17 respectively.

Señor Edgar works part-time in an Employee Association and he also has a small book and photocopying store, where he works from midday until nighttime. Here, he sells bookstore goods and carries out computer and photocopying jobs. He also sells different flavor ice-creams in cups, cones and different sized pots. He describes himself as a dynamic man who does all sorts of things to help his family.

Señor Edgar wants to invest the loan in the purchase of notebooks, different sized sheets of paper, archive folders, cards and other items to supply his store. He is grateful to the foundation and to kiva for the opportunity given to him.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, different sized sheets of paper, archive folders, cards and other items

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Yenny; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia se sigue dedicando al trbajo en una botica,ella vende medicinas y trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este trbajo la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su botica. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas para su botica. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member's name is Yenny. She is 25 years old and single. She works in a pharmacy selling medicine. She works from 8 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. With this job, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her pharmacy. She is asking for the loan to buy medicine for her pharmacy. 

Yenny is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Mariela; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos para la salud,ella vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien sigue trabajando como psicologa,ella trabaja en un consultorio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos naturales para la salud . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos naturales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member's name is Mariela. She is 35 years old and married. She is still working at her business selling health products. She sells independently from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She also continues to work as a psychologist in a doctor's office. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her natural health products. She is asking for the loan to buy natural products wholesale.

Mariela is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy natural products wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora Idalina, quien se informo sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras y luego de eso formo a sus amigas y vecinas. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, integrado por 15 mujeres.
La Sra. Idalina se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas y demás. Cuenta que vive en pareja hace varios años y con sus hijos que también la ayudan bastante. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por ayudar a su marido y a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This committee was started thanks to Señora Idalina, who found out about the program for enterprising women and later formed the group with her friends and neighbors. At present the group is in its second cycle and has 15 women.

Idalina works as a street vendor of all types of products, such as sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more. She says she has lived with her spouse for several years and also with her children who help her a lot. She remarks that everything she has done is to help her husband and family.
 
She is asking for the loan to buy sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more to increase her stock and provide for her customers. She is thankful to the foundation for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La  socia Juana;  tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos para la salud,ella trabaja en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un local donde pueda vender los productos para la salud . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la salud al por mayor.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She continues to work in the business selling health products. She works independently from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. With this business she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to expand and have a locale where she can sell her health products. She is asking for the loan to buy health products wholesale.

Juana is grateful for the support given to her and also committed to making the payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy health products wholesale.

loans.name: Sandra Arelis

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 8 años  los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas y edredones las mismas que las realiza puerta a puerta. En las tardes y noches ella instala un local en su casa en el cual vende Hamburguesas, corviches, jugos, sodas y otros alimentos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 17h00 hasta las 21h00 en la venta de sus bocadillos y las ventas puerta a puerta las realizan tres días a la semana en las mañanas,  lleva más de 7 años en su  negocio y  le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sabanas, edredones y varios víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la facilidad para realizar los pagos.
 
Su sueño es ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Solidaridad communal bank meet every two weeks in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabí, which for many years has been known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  

This is where Sandra, age 27, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 8.  The children go to school, and her husband is a merchant.  She is a very good housewife who devotes herself to commerce.  She sells sheets and quilts door to door.  In the afternoons and evenings she sets up a place in her house where she sells hamburgers, “corviches” (deep-fried stuffed pastries made with bananas, fish and onion), juice, soda, and other foods.

She works every day from 5:00 p.m. until 9:00 p.m. selling her snacks.  She makes her door to door sales three mornings a week.  She has been in her business for over seven years, and it has gone very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy sheets, quilts, and various supplies to prepare food.  She has been in her communal bank for over four years.  She likes the ease of making the payments.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts, and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Ketty Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años  de edad, el mayor de ellos estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es un muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de utensilios de cocina como sartenes, platos, ollas, cucharas, entre otras muchas cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también se desplaza en su carro a otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas, aprovecha donde hay ferias que es cuando más vende, muchas veces ella también le acompaña a su esposo a realizar las ventas. Ellos llevan en este negocio por más de 10 años y les va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio para comprar ollas, platos, cucharas, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son  rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Solidaridad communal bank meet every two weeks in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabí, which for many years has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  

This is where we meet Ketty, age 35.  She is married and has three children, ages 15, 10, and 6.  The oldest child goes to high school, and the youngest children go to elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who is getting the loan to help her husband in his business.  He sells all types of kitchen utensils like frying pans, dishes, pots, spoons and many other items.  He sells door to door.  He also travels in his car to other cities to make his sales.  He takes advantage of the fairs, which is when he sells the most.  Many times she accompanies her husband to make the sales.  They have been in this business for over ten years, and it has gone very well for them.

She will use this loan to stock the business with more pots, plates, and spoons, etc.  She has been in her communal bank for six cycles.  She likes it because the loans are quick and without so many requirements.

Her dream is to have a place in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy  pots, plates, and spoons, etc.

loans.name: Ross Mere

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Ross Mere; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia lleva diferentes productos al las tiendas de abarrotes,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabaja el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ross Mere, age 29, is single and has one child.  She continues devoting herself to the business of selling basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She takes different products to the grocery stores.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  It is throught his business that she gets her child ahead.

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil wholesale.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Edicta Beatriz

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Edicta, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos que es soltero aun viven con ella. Su marido tiene un negocio propio.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de alquiler de maquinas lavadoras de ropa, adema sella también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, carteras, zapatillas y de productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00 ya que a veces s esposo sale a entregar las maquinas y es ella quien se queda en el local vendiendo y tomando los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, carteras, sandalias y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen esta viejo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of Unión y Solidaridad Communal Bank meet in San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we met Edicta.  She is 57 years old and married, and from this relationship has three children who are already grown.  One of her children is single and still lives with her.  Her husband has his own business.

She and her husband have a business renting washing machines.  She also works selling clothing of all types, purses, sandals, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells in her house where she has a small space.  She works every day from 8:00 until 6:00, since sometimes her husband leaves to deliver the machines and she stays in the space selling and taking orders from customers.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been doing this work for more than 12 years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing, wallets, sandals, and Yanbal products.  She has been in the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because of the help they offer with the loans.

Her dream is to buy another car since the one she has is old.

loans.use: to buy clothing, purses, sandals, and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Monserrate Soledad

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Monserrate, Tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 19, 17 y 8 años de edad, los mayores ya son independientes, el menor estudia en escuela y a es quien vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres en un mercado de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Trabajan desde las 05h00  hasta las tres de la  tarde, ella le ayuda con el negocio mientras él se desplaza a otro mercado de mayoristas a comprar más de los productos que necesita para darle a  sus clientes lo mejor ya que esta es la clave para tener muchos clientes, ofreciendo un buen producto, limpio y al precio justo, llevan 4 años dedicados a  esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas y verduras para su negocio. La señora Monserrate es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Unión y Solidaridad meet bimonthly in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.  

Here we meet Señora Monserrate who is 38 years old and is in a common law marriage that has produced three children ages 19, 17 and 8.  The older two are adults and the youngest attends school and lives at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  

Together with her husband they have a business selling fruits and vegetables at a market in the city of Portoviejo.  They work from 5:00 am until 3:00 in the afternoon.  She works the market while he travels to other wholesale markets to buy more products that they need in order to offer their customers the best.   The key to having a lot of customers is offering a good, clean product at a fair price.  They have been doing this for 4 years.  
  
The loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables for their business.  Señora Monserrate is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because the interest rates are lower than other loan institutions.  

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amelia Sebastiana

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Amelia. Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, casados  e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 06h00 hasta las  15h00. Ella prepara desayunos y almuerzos y cada día prepara algo diferente para que sus clientes no se aburran de la misma comida, ella  trabaja sola.   Tiene su restaurante por 12 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos y eso la hace especial.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.  Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos ya que no piden tantos requisitos. 

Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The San Pablo parish of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, is where the member of the “Unión Y Solidaridad” (Unity and Solidarity) communal bank meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Amelia.  She’s 49 years old, married, and has two adult children, both married and on their own.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a small restaurant in her home, where she prepares delicious dishes, and works Monday through Saturday from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.  She prepares daily breakfasts and lunches and makes something different every day so that her customers don’t tire of the same food.  She works alone and has been doing this for 12 years.  Things have always gone well for her and her customers prefer her because the seasonings she adds to her dishes make them special.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other food to prepare her dishes.  She is the communal bank’s founder and she enjoys it because of the ease in getting loans because they don’t have too many requirements.

Her dream is to have her own house, as she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una hija  de 11 años que estudia en colegio. Cuatro de ellos aún viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella es modista aprendió corte y confección  en un centro artesanal hace varios años.
 
Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora ropa para niñas las mismas que coloca en una vitrina para la venta. Además de su taller de costura también tiene una papelería  en su mismo local el cual atiende al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos. En estos días también está vendiendo ropa y zapatos para aprovechar la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo ya que las personas compran bastante estos productos. Lleva más de  5 años en su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva más de  5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique y un taller más grande con más máquinas y operarias.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Unión y Solidaridad meet bimonthly in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.  

Here we meet Señora Rosa who is 52 years old, married and from this marriage, has five children.  Four of them are adults and she has an 11 year old daughter who attends primary school.  Four of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant. She is a seamstress who learned her trade at a craft center several years ago.  

She has a small sewing shop in her house where she works sewing all types of clothing. She works based on her orders from individuals.  She also makes girl's clothing that she displays in a glass case to sell.  In addition to her sewing shop, she also has a stationary store in her home which she attends to while she is works in her shop.  Right now she is also selling clothing and shoes to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year season as people buy a lot of these products.  She has been running her business for 5 years and things are going well for her.  
 
She will use this new loan to buy clothing, shoes, fabric, thread and other sewing materials.  She has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years.  She likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  

Her dreams are to have a boutique and a much larger shop with more machines and operators.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, fabric, thread and other sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks, candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Viviana Azucena

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad. El marido es albañil. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a vender productos por catálogo, vende ropa, zapatos, sandalias y productos de Yanbal, Esika y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. La ropa y calzado los recibe en el centro de la ciudad en una distribuidora. Tiene dos años y medio que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. 

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y sandalias.
 
Sus sueños son estudiar una carrera universitaria y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Unión Y Solidaridad' community bank meet in San Pablo parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 23-year-old Viviana who lives with her common-law husband and has two children who are 5 and 3 years old.  Her husband is a builder.  This is Viviana's fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.

Viviana is a housewife who, in order to make her own money, sells catalog products.  She sells clothing, shoes, sandals, and Yanbal, Esika and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week, and makes her sales door to door and to order.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  She gets the clothing and footwear from a distributor in the city center.  She has been in this business for two and a half years and it is going very well.

Viviana will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, shoes and sandals.  Her dreams are to study at university and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes, shoes and sandals

loans.name: María Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 52 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos que es soltero vive con ella.
 
Ella es  una gran mujer  que ha tenido que luchar muy duro para salir adelante con sus hijos, desde hace mucho tiempo atrás se dedica a  lavar ropa ajena y  en sus ratos libres dedica su tiempo al comercio, vende productos por catálogos de Avon, Lebel, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días tanto lavando ropa como en sus ventas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, ella aprovecha para visitar a sus clientes en las noches ya a esa hora está desocupada y encuentra a sus clientes, lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad comercial.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.  Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco ella empezó su negocio que le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Unión Y Solidaridad' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet 52-year-old María.  She is a single mother and has three children who are all adults.  She has worked cleaning other people's clothes for a long time.  In her free time she sells catalog products from Avon, Lebel and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day cleaning clothes and selling her products.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells to order.  She visits her customers in the evenings as this is when she has some free time.  She has been in this business for two years.

María will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and she likes it because she used one of her loans from the bank to start her business.  This has helped her to get ahead in life.

María's dream is to do well in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase ice cream to sell later

loans.name: Magali  Marlene

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Magali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores de edad y uno de 15 años, todos sus hijos viven en su casa el mayor ya es profesional y los siguientes  estudian en Universidad y colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales de una marca Norteamericana y también vende bisutería de visón, ella vende sus productos en su casa aunque una que otra vez también entrega a domicilio,  le realizan muchos pedidos sus clientes ya que sus productos son muy buenos. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar productos naturales y bisutería de visón. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del grupo.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the parish of San Pablo, of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Banco Comunal Unión Y Solidaridad meet every fifteen days.

It is here that we met Magali. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children from that relationship. Two of them are grown and one is fifteen years old. All her children live at home with her. The oldest is a professional and the others study at university and high school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

She is a very good mother in that in order to help her children with the cost of their studies she is in business selling natural products from a North American brand. She also sells inexpensive jewelry and eyewear. She sells her products from her home although once in a while she does home delivery. She fulfills a lot of orders from her customers and her products are very good. She works every day, selling on credit and collecting every fifteen days. She has been doing this for three years and it's going very well.

She's going to use this loan to buy natural products and inexpensive eyewear. She's been with the Banco Comunal since the beginning, she is the president, and she likes it because of the benefits that the group receives.

Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy natural products and inexpensive jewelry.

loans.name: Jacinta Narcisa

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar vive la señora Jacinta, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, todos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos aun vive  con ella. Su esposo es conserje en un edificio. 

Ella para ganar algo de dinero por su cuenta se dedica a varias actividades, en su casa tiene un pequeño corral en el cual cría pollos, los mismos que entrega a comerciantes cuando tienen un peso adecuado, además en su casa también tiene un negocio en el cual vende colas, hielo, aguas y deliciosos helados que ella mismo prepara. Su negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco hace más de 4 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar alimento para pollos, sodas, frutas, azúcar y crema de leche para preparar los helados. Esta hace más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio con el cual se gana su dinero.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran bar.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión Y Solidaridad Communal Bank meet every two weeks in San Pablo parish in  Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabi province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Sra. Jacinta, 49, lives here. She is married and has two sons, both adults, and one of whom continues to live with her. Her husband is a janitor for a building.

In order to earn money, Jacinta engages in various activities on her own. She has a small pen at her home where she raises chickens, selling them to merchants when they gain sufficient weight. As well she has a home business where she sells colas, ice, water and delicious ice cream that she herself makes. She began her business with her first loan from the bank more than four years ago and it has done very well.

This loan is to purchase chicken feed, sodas, fruit, sugar and cream to prepare the ice cream. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for more than four years and she enjoys it because one of her loans enabled her to open her business from which she earns an income.

Her dream is to have a large bar one day.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, sodas, fruit, sugar and cream.

loans.name: Mba'apora Group

texts.es:
El comité Mba'apora se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto para poder fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Fidelina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende por la calle. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, lucha diariamente por sus 4 hijos ya que ella es madre soltera. Comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Fidelina solicita el crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras, como ser naranjas, manzanas, tomates, cebollas, y demás frutas y verduras. Ella al igual que sus amigas están agradecidas a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The Mba'apora communal bank was formed when several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso came together. All the members of the bank have independent businesses but they also carry out joint activities in order to strengthen their solidarity.

Sra. Fidelina is one of the bank members. She is a street vendor and sells fruits and vegetables. She is a very hardworking woman with a great desire to succeed. She manages every day on behalf of her children since she is a single mother. She says that she is very satisfied with her work and the training the group receives.

Fidelina is requesting the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, such as oranges, apples, tomatoes, onions and others. She, together with her friends, is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for later sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit and chickens

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo. Todas son mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras, que se esfuerzan día a día por darle lo mejor a sus familias. El grupo actualmente se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de las miembros es Gloria, quien se dedica a la peluquería, nos comenta que siempre esta con muchos clientes gracias a la buena atención que les brinda. Gracias a su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de Shampoo, enjuagues, tintes para pelos, spray y demás insumos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
17 women from Ciudad del Este have come together with the intention of helping one another by working as a team. They are all fighting and hardworking women who make an effort day after day to give the best to their families. The group is currently in its third loan cycle of the foundation's program for enterprising women.

One of the members is Gloria, who works in hairstyling. She tells us that she always has a lot of customers thanks to the attentiveness she gives them. Thanks to her business she's been able to get ahead and help her family. She wants to be able to continue growing and this is why she always tries hard. She's asking for a loan to buy shampoo, rinses, hair dyes, hairspray, and other supplies necessary for her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, hair dyes, hairspray, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Mejor Bienestar Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mejor Bienestar"se originó a través de promociones que se realizaron en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Señora Inocencia es la Presidenta del grupo; trabaja vendiendo leche por el barrio; cría chancho y gallina. Anhela progresar con la fundación y poder llegar al nivel más alto que puede llegar un comité. Nos comenta que ella empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, lo cual es muy sacrificado. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Inocencia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes. Ella agradece a la fundación y  kiva por la ayuda que le da.
texts.en:
The “Mejor Bienestar” committee originated because of promotions in the neighborhood.  All the members are from the same zone and know each-other as neighbors.  Their objective is to work, strengthen their spirit of unity, and reach the maximum level of the program.

Inocencia is the group’s president and sells milk in the neighborhood.  She also raises pigs and chickens.  She wants to progress with the foundation and be able to reach the highest level that she can with the committee.  She says that she begins working very early in the morning, which requires a lot of sacrifice.  She wants to continue to grow and be able to continue helping her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy milk so she can resupply herself and meet her customer demand.  She appreciates the foundation and Kiva for the help they give.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys tiene 25 años de edad, está casada con el señor Denis quien tiene 25 años de edad, ambos nacidos en la ciudad de Caacupé. La pareja tiene 1 hija  de 6 años.
Gladys comenta que tiene un copetín donde trabaja mucho y más en este tiempo cuando se acerca la fecha del aniversarios de la virgen de Caacupé, donde la venta de comestibles aumenta considerablemente por la concentración de gente por la zona. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y ser una gran empresaria
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, hortalizas, panificados, condimentos y demás insumos que necesita para hacer los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
Gladys is 25 years old. She is married to Denis, 25 years old. They were both born in the city of Caacupé. They have one daughter, 6 years old.

Gladys says that she has a fast food counter where she works a lot, and even more so now around the feast of the virgin of Caacupé, when food sales increase considerably due to the number of people in the area. One of her dreams is to be able to continue growing and be a great businesswoman. 

She is asking for the loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, bread products, condiments, and other supplies that she needs to make the food she sells.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, vegetables, bread products, condiments, and other supplies

loans.name: Sop Ch Serigne Mokhtar Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Mokhtar est créé le 29 mars 2008, il est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même village et l'embouche est leur activité principale.

Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 39 ans, femme mariée elle est mère de six enfants et mène une activité d'embouche et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en tissu wax marron blanc avec un châle bleu sur les épaules.


Elle achéte des béliers maigres qu'elle engraisse et revend à l'approche des remboursements de ses prêts.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des béliers pour renforcer davantage son activité.

Elle aide son mari pour l'entretien de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Mokhtar was created on March 29th, 2008. The group is composed of eight women who live in the same village and share the fattening of livestock as their main business.

Awa, the person in charge, is a 39-year-old married woman as well as the mother of six children. She manages a livestock fattening business, and has had a good track-record in this domain.

In the photo, Awa is standing on the right dressed in brown & white wax [pagne cloth] with the blue shawl over her shoulders. She purchases skinny rams, which she then fattens and resells before her loan repayments. 

Her loan will allow her to buy rams in order to continue to strengthen her business. She helps her husband to support their family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Sop Cheikh Darou Assane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Cheikh Darou Assane est créé le 29 mars 2008, il est composé de dix huit femmes qui entretiennent d'excellentes relations; l'embouche et le petit commerce constituent leurs activités principales.


La responsable Codou est âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée mère de cinq enfants et a un en charge; elle s'adonne à l'agriculture et l'embouche ovine et excelle dans cette dernière activité depuis un bon bout de temps avec une bonne expérience.Sur la photo elle est accroupie à gauche habillée en mauve.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des béliers pour engraisser.

Elle participe aux dépenses familiales et constitue son épargne avec ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Cheikh Darou Assane was created on March 29th 2008, and is made up of eight women who maintain excellent relationships between themselves. The fattening [of livestock] and small business are their main occupations.  

The borrower, Codou, is 41 years old. She is a married mother of five children and has one dependent; she dedicates herself to the raising and fattening of sheep, and has excelled in the latter for a long time with a good track record.  

In the photo, Codou is crouching on left side dressed in purple.  This loan will enable her to purchase sheep for fattening. Codou contributes to family expenditures and uses her profits to build her savings.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Cheam, 63, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Two of her daughters are employed as garment workers. Due to low income from her daughters' salaries, Cheam would like to request a loan of USD 500 in order to run a new business by purchasing groceries to sell from home in order to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase rice to resell and  to build a fence and a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat, 46 years-old, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fruit vendor. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Three of her children are employed as hotel staff. Due to the difficulty of transporting her fruit to sell, Nat is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike to carry fruit to resell. By doing so, she can transport her fruit to resell faster and in bigger amounts. She hopes she could support her youngest child to study until he graduates from high school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry fruit to resell.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga, 56, is widowed and resides with two nieces in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she raises ducks, chickens and pigs at home. Her nieces are employed at a garment factory. She is asking for a loan of USD 600 in order to purchase a motorbike for her nieces to drive to work. In the future, she plans to purchase more piglets to raise in order to generate more income to support her family and build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her nieces to drive to work.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en: Sokhim, 29, is married and resides with her husband and son in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She is a farmer. Her husband is an ice cream vendor who carries ice cream to sell around the village and market. Sokhim is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to increase capital in her husband's business in order to run an ice cream store at home. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her son to study until he gets a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to increase capital in her husband's business in order to run an ice cream store at home

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en: Thavy, 38, is married and resides with her husband and five children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She is a skirt weaver. Her husband works for the military in Phnom Penh. All of her children are still in her care. Thavy is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more silk to weave skirts at home which she will sell. In the future, she would like to build a kitchen and support her children's studies until they each get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more silk to weave skirts for sale

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai, 66, resides in Prey Veng Province. Sai grows rice and her husband repairs motorbikes for people in his village. Sai is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to operate car-and-motorbike washing services. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Sai would like to use any additional income to expand her husband’s repairing services. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to operate car-and-motorbike washing services

loans.name: Ley

texts.en:
Ley, 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She also looks after her father and nephew.

Ley’s husband is a motor taxi driver. She used to be a farmer, but because she earned so little, she changed her work. Since 2001 she has wrapped sticky-rice cakes to sell at the market.

Two of Ley’s children are employed in a garment factory. Since the factory is far from home, she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase a motorbike for them to commute to work.

In the future, Ley plans to run a poultry farm to generate more income to support the family, build a kitchen and support her children in their studies until they both earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 43, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, and her husband is a construction worker. Phally is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more land to grow rice. In the future, she would like to purchase rice to store in the warehouse to sell when the price is higher, build a fence around her house, and support her children's education until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more land to grow rice.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 50, resides in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband grow rubber trees for rubber to sell. Lim is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a tractor to plow the farmland in order to grow rubber trees. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. 

In the future, Lim would like to use any additional income to purchase pigs to raise and sell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a tractor to plow the farmland for a rubber plantation.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn, 53, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a distiller, and her husband repairs bicycles at home. All of her children work at a garment factory. Because the salaries at this garment factory are small, Horn is requesting a loan of $1200 to pay for her son’s passport fee so that he can go to Thailand to find a job there. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's bicycle repair business, to build a new house, and to send her son to a mechanical training center.

loans.use: to pay for her son's passport fees.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, ages 16 and 19. Her husband works as a carpenter and farmer.

Cecilia makes roofing materials from dried nipa leaves. She has been selling nipa roofing to her community for three years. Cecilia earns 5000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase more nipa leaves to make roofing materials. Cecilia hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa leaves to make roofing materials.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol, 23, is married, and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store at home. Her husband installs and repair speakers, and also rents speakers for wedding ceremonies and funerals. Kol is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to pull the cart which carries the rental speakers. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store, build new wooden house, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to pull the cart that carries rental speakers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old, is married, and has three children; two of them are currently going to school. Her husband is a farmer, who helps her to provide for their needs. Helen has been operating her retail store for four years and she is thankful because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about P400 every day and uses her profit to pay for her family's electricity bills and daily needs. 

Helen suffered a few difficulties in her business due to a lot of unpaid credit from her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of P50,000 to allow her to buy groceries, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads and other items for her retail business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads and other items.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn is a 32-year-old who has two children and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Emalyn is engaged in a fishing business venture, selling seafood products including fish, crabs, and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for 2 years and uses a  motorcycle to sell her fish from place to place or house to house. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP through this work.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Recently, Emalyn joined GDMPC to gain financial support and assistance for her business, which she hopes to improve and expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Menard

texts.en:
Menard is 40 years old and lives in Solangon, San Juan, Siquijor.  He is married with four children.

Menard has a construction supply business through which he earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month.  He has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase coconut trees to use for house construction, and to deliver to his buyer.

Menard has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Menard hopes both to improve his living conditions and to be able to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase of coconut trees to use for house construction, and deliver to his buyer.

loans.name: Adelo

texts.en:
Adelo is married with five children. He is 49 years old and lives in Tonggo, Tudela.

Adelo is a farmer, and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for planting crops.

Adelo has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Adelo hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en: After receiving his first loan, I Wayan wants to continue to borrow to improve his business. Still with his pig for pork rolls business, I Wayan has a plan to sell the pigs at a market nearby to earn more income. He will use this loan to purchase four piglets and will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food. His primary goal is to save to support his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and food.

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art, 51, resides in Prey Veng Province. She and her husband are farmers. When possible, her husband also operates a mechanical plow that is available for rental to farmers in his village. Art is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a rice threshing machine for personal use and for rental to villagers. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Art would like to use any additional income to purchase a truck to transport and sell rice. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a rice threshing machine for personal use and rental.

loans.name: Retchel

texts.en:
Retchel is 27 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 2 children.

Retchel has a general store in partnership with her sister-in-law.  She also engages in a buy-and-sell business for dry goods.  She earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 49,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Retchel has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married with 4 children. Andresa is 52 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Andresa has a dried fish retail business to earn a living.  She has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 2000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 13000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

Andresa has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Andresa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a small farmer who had been planting and harvesting rice for almost 10 years. He was very proud that through the income generated from his business, he was able to pay allowances and tuition fees for his children. He had two children attending elementary school.

All Ricardo wants is to improve his crop production in order to make his family financially stable. As of now, Ricardo has insufficient funds, and he would like to borrow 20,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for farming. He hopes that through these farm supplies his crop will produce an abundant harvest.

Ricardo hopes to save money for his children's college education, so that they can earn degrees and seek good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of clothes needed in her business

loans.name: 05.04.28 Điện Biên Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Lan is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. Lan lives with two dependents in the city of Thanh Hoa in Thanh Hoa Province. Lan is the group leader of the "05.04.28 Điện Biên Solidarity Group," which consists of four members.

In 2009, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in her business for 5 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Lan hopes to have enough money to provide for her children and to ensure that her family is healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Nguyen is 27-years-old with 2 children who are small. Being  a farmer, she focuses on growing rice. To have more income, she works as a butcher in a local market. Her business started 7 years ago. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,152,000  Viet nam dong from SEDA ‘s credit program to buy  fresh pork for selling

Hang is 42-years-old. She runs a business of selling snails for some small restaurants. She wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to  expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh pork for selling.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman and has five children. Conchita lives in Catadman, Ozamis City. She is 52-years-old.

Conchita owns and operates a sea weeds production business to earn a living and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000.00 to purchase more sea weeds to sell. In 2011, Conchita become a member of GDMPC. In the future, Conchita wants to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase more sea weed to sell.

loans.name: 3.5.84 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mai has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Mai is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. Mai supports one dependent with her business in the city of Thanh Hoa in Thanh Hoa Province. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 84 Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group.

This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mai has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is a lack of capital.

Mai hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy, and, with her business profits, Mai hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a determined and kind person. She is 33 years old. She is married and has two children in school. She and her husband work together to earn a living. Mary Jane runs her clothing shop, while her husband is a vendor of fruits in the public market of Santiago City. Mary Jane has been in this kind of business for 12 years, and she earns about 10,000 PHP a month, which she uses to pay for their daily needs, her children's expenses, and the family's monthly electric bill.

Mary Jane would like financial assistance amounting to 15,000 PHP to buy different kinds of ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing shop. She is hoping that she can obtain a larger profit to better support her children in their daily needs and to provide for their education.

In the future, Mary Jane is expecting that she can continue to improve her clothing shop business and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing shop.

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut continues to borrow from MUK to increase her pig business. After succeeding with the last loan, she feels confident to run this business. Her husband also fully supports this and he helps her to maintain the pigs. This loan will be used to purchase six new piglets and feed. All the profit from the business will be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase six piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 35-years-old with 2 children who are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice. Besides that work, she is managing her wood-work shop to make desks, tables, beds and some others equipment. Joining in our credit program in 2008, she finds that  micro credit is very suitable with her business. For  a new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,184,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as raw material for the manufacturing process.

loans.use: to buy wood as raw material for manufacturing process.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
The word honor best describes Wilma. She is married to Arturo and together they care for their family farm. They have two children, Aldrich, who is 26 years old and Bernadeth, who is 24 years old. Aldrich has graduated from elementary school and Bernadeth graduated from college, but she is still unemployed due to the stiff employment competition in their area. They live in a community in Rizal province of Isabela. Agriculture is the main source of income for the people there.

Wilma and her husband farm different crops, including rice, corn and vegetables. In a week, they are able to earn at least P 1,000 from selling vegetables, which they harvest on their own. It takes them three to five months to harvest and then be able to sell the rice and corn crops.

To maintain their farming business and to avoid high-interest debts with other lenders, Wilma has asked for a loan of P 27,000 so she can finance their farming needs, like fertilizer and seed to grow. 

In the future, Wilma hopes that she can sustain the needs of her family, and expand her farm business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for her farming business

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch, 50, resides in Prey Veng Province. Toch and her husband are farmers. Toch is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field and to transport rice from the field. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Toch would like to use any additional income to purchase a rice harvesting machine. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field and transport rice from the field.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman having five children. Margie is 36-years-old, residing at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Margie owns and operates a farm land, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living and she's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 43,000.00 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay cost for farm maintenance. 

In 2000, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. In the future, Margie wants to make improvements to her house and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay cost for farm maintenance.

loans.name: 03.2.86 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinh operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Sinh is 26 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 86 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. Sinh lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Sinh has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Sinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
This is Naima, 24, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jamalodin, 26, a vendor, and she is a mother to three children. Two are in elementary school and the youngest is still a toddler. While attending to her family, she also keeps herself busy by attending to her business. Her income helps them to maintain daily expenses. 

Naima owns a buy-and-sell business. She buys used clothes. She earns money by getting the items at a lower price in bulk, sorting them, and selling them by piece. From a capital of 3,500 PHP per bulk, she can sell all items at around 5,000 PHP; thus she has a profit of 1,500 PHP. Her outlet is located in one of the crowded market places in Quezon city where her items are sold easily, especially on payday. Her regular customers are the market-goers and passers-by. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more clothes and items that she will display in her stall in order to attract more passers-by. The more items displayed at the store the better. She will gain income and have better profits. She saves the profit for utility bills and the children’s expenses in school. 

Naima hopes that her business will last and continue to help her in sustaining her family's needs. She wants all her children to finish their studies and fulfill their own dreams and aspirations in life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* meeting as it inspires her to be a more God fearing and God loving individual. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of clothes and items needed in her business.

loans.name: Junel

texts.en:
Junel is 23 years old and lives with his parents. Instead of lazing at home, he has engaged himself in a business of rice farming, as source of income. He wasn't able to seek a better employment because he only finished high school. He plants and harvests rice to sell.

As of now he has had insufficient funds, so he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. He would like to improve his crop production so that he can help make his family live fortunately.

Junel wants to achieve financial independence, and he also aspires to have a wife and children someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Vu

texts.en: Vu is 42 years old and has 2 children who are of school age.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising pigs. She also manages a small wood working shop. Participating in SEDA’s credit program since 2008, she has used loans to invest in expanding her income-raising scale.  For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as material for her wooden item making process.

loans.use: to buy wood as material for her wooden item making process.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has a happy family, which inspires him to work hard. He has a farm where he cultivates rice and corn. He is married to Merlita, a full time housewife. They have been gifted with five children, and four of their children are already married. Three graduated from college. Two of the children work abroad as domestic helpers. One of the children is a high school graduate. The youngest is a third year high school student.

Victor is 54 years old. He supports his family through his farm. He manages a half hectare rice field and a 2.5 hectare corn field. Aside from managing his own farm, he sometimes works as a laborer for extra income on other farms.

Victor is requesting a loan of P 20,000 for additional working capital. This will help to sustain his business and grow the business, so it can become more profitable.

Victor wants to send his youngest child to school and help her finish a college degree so she will not experience the hardship of farming. He is getting older and weaker so he is hoping that he can provide all her educational needs. Victor has promised himself that he will do everything he can for the sake of his children.

loans.use: to access additional working capital to sustain and grow his farming business

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina is a 58-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her youngest child still goes to school. Crispina has been in the business of raising hogs for 30 years.
