She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and materials to improve her pig pen. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month with her business. She works hard to improve her business and to support her family. She hopes for her children to have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and materials to improve her pig pen.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 29, resides in Prey Veng Province. She is employed at a garment factory and her husband sells fruits. Chenda is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to send her two children to a good school. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, 60, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a married to Noly, 57, a businessman. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are now working, and her youngest is in high school.  She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard in order to help her husband meet their daily needs and expenses.

She is a dressmaker.  She cuts and sews dresses, office and school uniforms, skirts and seat covers. She also sews dresses that she sells. The clothes that she usually sews are for kids. As a mother she is aware that parents prioritize buying clothes for their children before themselves.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in her daily sales.

Amelia is requesting a loan amounting to Php 26,000 that will help her to maintain her business well.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more textiles, fabrics and thread, and to maintain her sewing machines. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to continue paying utility bills and save some for the future of her children. 

She dreams that her business will last and continue to grow. She wants her children to finish their studies and be able to have a comfortable life some day. She never fails to attend the fellowship* meeting every week as it helps her to entrust to the Lord all her plans and dreams in life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose became a widower during the early stages of his marriage. Since then, he has been both the father and mother of his three daughters: Lean – 19 years old, a college student; Shella – 18years old,  Melvin Joy – 16 years old. Jose is very assiduous in his farming business, but due to lack of money, he could not sustain all his farming needs. He really needs to continue his farming business because it is the only means for him to send his children to school and for his eldest child to pursue her college education. 

Jose requests a loan of P 27,000 to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. He is really thankful to God that there people who are willing to lend to him without asking for high interest compared to the traders. He is proud that despite being a single parent, he still manages to send his children to school. He is able to do this because he manages the farm and hog raising businesses well. 

Jose is a man with a word of honor. He does not promise anything that he is not sure of. He said that he will sacrifice everything to provide a better life for his children, so he has to work hard and pray for his success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farm business

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh is 49 years old with 2 children who are grown. Being a wood carver, she makes decorative wooden parts for a small wood working shop that started  10 years ago.  Joining our credit program in 2008, she finds that it is very suitable for her business. At present, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as material and some tools that serve her carving process.

loans.use: to buy wood and some tools.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is single. He is 30 years old and resides in Labinay, Ozamis City, Philippines. He owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. He has been 7 years in this business. Each month, he earns about 3,700 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In 2011, Dante become a member of GDMPC. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina lives in a community where the people work together to better their livelihoods and develop their village. She is 60 years old and already a widow. She is responsible for raising her five children by herself. She supports her five children through her farm. Saturnina is thankful to God that she was able to raise her children to grow up with good attitudes, even though she didn't have enough money to provide them with a high level of education.

Currently, Saturnina hopes to create better opportunities in her farming and hog-raising business. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 so she can buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. 

She is glad that they have their own hand tractor because it makes farm cultivation easy. The family also owns a tricycle, which serves as another source of income. Saturnina believes that praying to God is the best way to become successful in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow for her farm

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than is 58 years old with 4 children who are grown. She has a shop that sells Vietnamese traditional cigarettes. Her business started 10 years ago and    brings in good revenue for her. Joining our credit program in 2007, she has used loans effectively in maintaining this business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more of this kind of cigarettes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more of this kind of cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 40, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Sandy, an employee, and a mother to her three children. She keeps herself busy attending to the needs of her family and business. 

Rosalinda owns a bakery. She sells and offers a variety of breads everyday in her community. She believes that people nowadays prioritize the three basic needs, and bread is not an exemption as a regular meal in the morning and at snack time. Her regular customers are the people in her local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials and ingredients needed in her bakery.  She wants to have more profit that she will save for their future.

Rosalinda hopes that her business will grow and last longer. She dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies and earn a diploma.  A comfortable and good life is her dream for them to enjoy in old age. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* meeting as it inspires her to be more submissive to the will of God. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials and ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Being hardworking and patient is the key to success, according to Patricia, a 46-year-old woman living in the village of Carikrikkan province of Isabela. The main source of income is agriculture. Patricia engages in farming. Through this, she can send her children to school for higher education.

Patricia is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for her farm business. Aside from farming, Patricia also engages in hog-raising. She hopes that someday all her children will finish their studies to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farm business

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is a simple man full of hopes. He always believes in the saying, “If others can, why can’t I?” 

Loreto is married to Josephine, who is working as a recruiter of domestic helpers wanting to work abroad. They are blessed with three healthy children. They live in the village of Rizal, one of the farthest barangays in Quirino province, wherein farming is the major source of livelihood. Loreto works as a farmer in their village, however, his income is not enough to meet all the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business. Loreto dreams that someday he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where she lives with her family of 8 adult children.She is aged 62 and has been in active farming for over 20 years with her farm currently producing poultry and milk for the local market. Her farm is currently manned by two farmhands.

Esther has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her boost both her poultry and dairy business. She will use 30,000 KES to build a modern dairy unit and the other 30,000 KES to buy more poultry birds. She aspires to rank among the major suppliers of both dairy and poultry product in the entire North Rift region of Kenya.

She laments of high costs of feeds and high fluctuation of farm produce prices within the local markets

loans.use: To buy poultry and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a father of 2 minors and has been practicing farming in his home area for 3 years. He produces milk, vegetables and tea for the local market. He also runs a transport business with his motorcycle.

Antony has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him build a modern dairy unit in his farm. He says his experience will enable him manage his farming effectively and earn more income to even boost his transport business. He adds the income will help him plan for the growth of his young family in terms of financial security.

He however laments of harsh weather conditions but remains greatful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhay is a single mother who, at 56 years old, is still working hard. To make a living, she cultivates rice crops in Prey Chor district. She usually grows rice twice a year, during both the rainy and dry seasons, earning an average of $2.50 per day. She has six children, three of whom are already married. Currently however, one of her married daughters doesn’t own a house and is living with Chhay at home. 

Mrs. Chhay wants this loan in order to buy a piece of land, on which she will build a thatched house for her daughter to live with her own family. The land is in a good location, where Chhay’s daughter can operate a business selling things to the local people. Chhay is very happy and appreciative of the support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Carlo

texts.en:
Carlo is an industrious farmer whose main concern is to improve his family's living conditions and to help his three children finish their studies. He is 39 years old, and has been operating his farming business for seven years, earning only PHP 20,000 during the last cropping season.

He used his income to purchase the daily needs of his family and for his children's allowances. This causes him not to save for his farm, even though farming requires greater capital input for him to gain a good harvest. Because of this, he is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice crops and farmland. 

He hopes to make his business more developed and profitable for the welfare of his family, even with the hardships he bumps into just to keep up his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice crops and farmland

loans.name: Milamel

texts.en:
Milamel is 36 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Milamel is married and has one child.

Milamel has a general store. She has had this business for six years. Milamel requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Milamel has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Milamel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 62 years old. Ponciana is married and has two adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Ponciana owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing sewing services to local community members. She has been in her business for 20 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Ponciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ponciana is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and thread. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and thread.

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 28 years old and is married with 2 children. She helps his husband in their farming business. She has 4 years of experience in this business. She is in need of a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase farm supplies and equipment, such as fuel for the tractor, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. She hopes to gain enough profit from her business to supplement her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment, such as fuel, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a widower with three grown-up children. The whole family lives in Isabela. For the last ten years, Fidel has been growing corn and rice. 

Fidel plans to use a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more seed and fertilizer for his farm.

Fidel very much hopes to gain additional profit from his farming business in order to finish long-needed repairs on his home next year.

loans.use: to buy more seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
As a farmer living in the Philippines, Roberto would like to achieve an abundant harvest during every crop season. Harvest season usually falls during the months of April and November. He earns about PHP 15,000 whenever he sells his crop. 

Roberto is 40 years old and still single. He lives with his mother in Roma Norte, Enrile. He had been involved in his farming business for almost 10 years. The profits earned from the business serves as their sustenance for meals and bills at home. Roberto is the breadwinner of the family. He is now asking for a loan to make his crop more productive by applying fertilizers and pesticides to it. He would like to ask for PHP 15,000 to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

In the future, Roberto would like to make his family economically stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Dios Ante Todo Group

texts.en:
Margo is the coordinator of her group, Dios Ante Todo 1, 2 and 3 (God first), located in a village where most of the citizens are Haitians. She lives in a modest home with one of her three children. With this effort, she can make extra income and help her long-term partner. In the meantime, she enjoys doing business.

Margo is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She runs a clothing sales business. She has had her business for nearly two years. She began her business by selling a dozen pairs of jean pants she bought with her first loan. 

Margo is planning to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing in different sizes for men and women. Christmas is a good season to do good sales. That is why she and her group are requesting this loan. She will reinvest the profits in her business by purchasing more products and expanding her business with more options and new clients. She dreams of becoming someone with a very important business.

Margo represents her group and many Haitians who emigrated to the Dominican Republic to improve their lives. In this group are a sample of 10 Haitian families fighting to overcome the Haiti crisis. Thanks to you for supporting this group.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: staple grains, sweets, instant products, drinks, soaps

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en:
Venchita is 55 years old and lives in Tinaclaan, Clarin. Venchita is single and has one child.

Venchita has a shop that sells clothes and shoes. Venchita has had this business for five years. Venchita requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase products for her clothing business.

Venchita has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Venchita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for her clothing business.

loans.name: Yvette Fay

texts.en:
Yvette is 24 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Yvette is married and has two children. 

Yvette has a general store that sells a variety of goods. Yvette has had this business for three years. Yvette requested a loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Yvette has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Yvette hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned  goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.en:
Lauro is 53 years old. He and Jojita started their family 33 years ago. They have six children. They live in the community of San Juan, in the Isabela province. He makes his living through agriculture because he enjoys working in the fields. He learned this work as a child, thanks to his parents' teaching. Lauro has his own plots of land, where he sows corn and rice. Throughout the years, he has had to confront challenges such as plagues, low prices, and lack of labourers.

Lauro is an admirable family man. Because of her job, Jojita had to move to the city, so Lauro takes care of the children. He does all the cooking and cleaning as if it were nothing, on top of working in the fields. With the help of labourers, who he pays by the day for their labour, Lauro is able to speed up his agricultural chores. His sales are considerable in May. During that time of the year, the price of rice is around 11 Pesos per kilo. This is very good for him and his family. 

Lauro is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business. Lauro dreams to buy transportation services. With this, he will be able to save on transportation for himself and his produce in the future.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his village. He has been a farmer for over ten years and earned PHP 18,000 during the last cropping. His desire is to boost up his previous profits, causing him to ask for a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. His wife also helps to plant and harvest rice to minimize his work.

Danny hopes that he can gain enough profits to pay for the education of his children and the development of their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 31 years old, single, and has one child. She lives in Gotocan Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Christy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years.

Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP through her business. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items in order to expand her product offerings. Christy has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

location.town: Gotocan Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en:
Venerando is 51 years old and has six children. He is widowed and stands as both father and mother to his children. He owns a hectare-sized plot of land, where he plants and harvests rice as the source of his income. He usually earns about PHP 15,000 to pay for labor costs and buy equipment used in farming. He pays for laborers who help him transplant rice seedlings. 

He would like to ask for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to pay for labor costs and buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Venerando would like to keep making better sales from his business to allow his family to live comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s animal feed business.

With the loan investment, Shameem's husband will purchase animal feed in larger quantities that will allow him to sell more and earn higher profits. He lives in the city that is famous for its' agricultural industry and most people there are associated with the farming and livestock profession. Animal feed is a high demand product.

Shameem is very supportive and sews clothes for her neighboring clients to financially support her husband. She has given birth to 4 children, all of whom are enrolled in the local school and getting their education. Shameem is hopeful that an investment will help her husband earn better income for the family and she will be able to continue providing education to her children.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah passbook) is Shameem.”

loans.use: to buy animal feed for an animal feed-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui is a 32-year-old farmer. He is married and has four children between the ages of three and ten years, the first three of whom are already in school. His pineapple, banana, milk, and tea produce is sold locally.

Kirui has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help him add another dairy cow into his farming business. He says the loan will enable him acquire a better and more productive breed than the ones he has currently. He say that the income he generates will go towards education of his children.

Kirui says that animal diseases and lack of funds deter the growth of farmers' businesses significantly, as they are limited in the acreage they farm and do not enjoy economies of scale.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khayrinisso

texts.ru: Хайриниссо жительница района Шахритус. Она замужем. Ей 31 год. У нее пятеро детей. Она занимается скотоводством. В основном она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Khayrinisso lives in the Shahrituz region. She's married, thirty-one years of age and has five children. She breeds cattle to make a living. 
Khayrinisso's asking for a loan in order to purchase some large cattle.

loans.use: to purchase large cattle.

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en: Bienvenido is a 47 year-old hardworking man with three children living in San Juan province of Isabela. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for ten years after starting with capital of P 8,000 and now he requested a loan amounting to P 20,000. His major hardships are: high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations and inflation. He has a goal of diversifying his farm. Bienvenido needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticide for his farm.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a farmer who lives in Roma Norte together with his wife and one child. He is planting and harvesting rice to sell. His wife also sells vegetables to the people in their place of residence for an additional income. The couple usually earns about P10,000 each month. The profits earned are just enough for the family's consumption. 
As of now he would like to improve his crop production so that he can make improvements to their living conditions. He has insufficient funds that is why he is asking for a loan of P10,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

Wilfredo hopes that through his patience, hardwork and God's guidance, he can lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, 61 years old and residing in Maribojoc,Tudela, is a married mother of two children. The owner of a motorcycle business that earns her approximately PHP 6000 each month, Anita has requested a loan of 48000 to purchase another transport vehicle. She has been a member of PMPC for five years, and hopes to save more for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to purchase another transport vehicle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a resident and a farmer in Nkubu, Kenya, is a 38-year-old married mother of two children of school-going age. A farmer for seven years, she currently produces bananas and potatoes for the local markets. She notes the high costs of inputs like fertilizers as her major business impediment.

Florence has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to venture into poultry farming by buying poultry and constructing a housing unit for the birds. She says this will help her diversify her farming business and enter the poultry field, which has not been fully exploited in the area. She plans to educate her children with the income.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonesa cooks and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Leonesa has been in her business for over 30 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Leonesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonesa is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 28 years old and has been in the farming business for 10 years. His farm now produces tea, milk, and maize for the local market. He is married, with two children ages 5 and 10 years, both of whom are in school.

Leonard has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says he wants to diversify his farming business and wants to seize the opportunity in poultry due to its high turnover compared to dairy farming. He adds that he will use the income to expand his dairy farming so as to take advantage of the economies of scale.

He says access to animal feeds is a challenge, but that it is surmountable if one runs a farm with more dairy animals. He is also happy with Juhudi Kilimo for providing the farming loans.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en:
Aljane is married and has one child. She is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Aljane operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and every month she earns PHP 15,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to repair her vehicle to provide better service.

Aljane has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Aljane hopes to improve and expand her business and to earn twice as much income from her business.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Zarina Begum's Group

texts.en:
A 57-year-old lady, Zarina begum lives with her family: a husband and four children (two sons and two daughters). Her eldest daughter is 35 years-old and the youngest is 25 years-old.  Her eldest son is 27 years-old and her youngest son is 24 years-old. 

Her husband has a stable job. 

Zarina is a caring lady. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities.   

All of her children are involved in different work and work to financially contribute to the family. Her elder daughter does sewing. Her work is home based. Her younger daughter works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her eldest son runs a grocery store in the community market while his younger brother works in a factory for a monthly wage. 

With this loan, her son will purchase groceries in bulk to be able to stock his store.  He has been operating his business for past many years. His experience and good dealing will help him increase his sales and profits. 

Zarina is very confident about the future expansion of her sons’ business after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zarina begum”.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa.  She is 56 years old and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a construction worker, and they have a child. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

Narcisa is a mineral water distributor. What she does is buy mineral water from wholesalers and resells it to her customers in five gallon containers for a profit. She also earns additional income by selling snacks in their area. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Narcisa dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She also hopes to have a mini store someday. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Pascaliah

texts.en:
Pascaliah is a resident and a farmer in Litein, South Rift Kenya. She is married and has five children.  She has been active in dairy farming for more than 10 years. She also works as a tailor, but her main business is dairy farming. Her farm currently runs with two farmhands and her milk produce is delivered to the local market.

Pascaliah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to build a modern dairy unit for her animals. She says the boost in her income from the improvement to her farm will be used to pay for the education of her last born child as well as to ensure the repayment of the loan.

She says a lack of finances and animal diseases are the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a construction worker.

Since the factory is far away from home, Samphors is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm, build a kitchen and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 37-year-old man from Western Kenya. He is married to Marry and they don’t have kids.

George operates a computer bureau business. He has been doing this business for the last six years and makes a monthly profit of 11,000 KES. He is taking his second loan with KADET Ltd. and will use the loan to complete his own premises and piping works and boost his supplies. He plans to plough back the anticipated profits into the business.

His dream is to open another branch at Muhuru Bay.

loans.use: to complete building and initiate piping works

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is disabled and their three kids are all employed.

She started her cosmetics retailing business in 2002 by renting a counter. Her business is stable. She is well known for her quality and relatively affordable products. In order to run her business successfully, she travels a lot and, therefore, she spends a lot of money on transportation. She is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy a car. It will save a lot of money and time to run her business.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 26 years old and is a married woman with 2 children aged 8 and 5. Her husband works as a carpenter and farmer.

Larisa sells roofing material made of Nipa palm leaves. She also sells fish to her community. Larisa earns 4,000 PHP per month. She plans to use her loan to buy more Nipa palm and fish to sell. Larisa hopes to have a successful business in the future. She also hopes to sustain her children' education.

loans.use: to buy more Nipa palm and fish to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
49 year-old Amelia has been working hard at her rice farming business in the village of San Juan for ten years. Amelia has been gaining successes in this business with her enterprising nature and unfailing diligence. She sells most of her crops to the buying station for corn and rice in their town.
Amelia is happily married with five good-natured children. Three of her children are in school and doing well.

Per cropping, Amelia says her sales returns total P 30,000. Her hope is that once she puts her loan proceeds into good and efficient use, her business's prospects will see a new lease on life. Amelia wants all the best for her family and business and she says she will go to every length, not only to improve on their current circumstances, but also to ensure that they all will enjoy a good and prosperous future. 

Amelia is asking for a loan of P 20,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. Amelia says she will use this loan to purchase high grade manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Esterlita sells food items like rice cakes and other delicacies. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month from this business. Esterlita plans to use her loan to purchase sugar, flour, sticky rice and other ingredients. Esterlita hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, sticky rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus 25 years old and is a farmer and livestock trader in his home area of Kitale. He runs his farm with the help of one employee and produces maize, beans, and milk for the local market. Titus is worried about high costs of input and animal diseases.

Titus is requesting a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will boost his milk production so that he can make direct deliveries to processors rather than to middlemen who are quite exploitative and pay low prices. Titus adds that his improved income will provide financial security to his young family.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gelane

texts.en:
Gelane is 34 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Señor, Sinacaban.  For the past five years, Gelane has operated a store where she sells camote cue (deep fried caramelized sweet potatoes). She has been a member of PMPC for six years.

Gelane is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase additional ingredients for her food business. In the future, she hopes to expand.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients

loans.name: Sapia

texts.en:
This is Sapia, who is 25, single, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating her general retail business. Sapia buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells it for a little profit. She sells bags, stuffed toys, and other similar products. She works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. Sapia's customers are attracted to her merchandise because of her low prices and variety. Her regular customers are local community members and passersby and she earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Sapia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate her business. She will purchase additional bags and stuffed toys to expand her product inventory. Sapia expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. In the coming years, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Sapia faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy bags, stuffed toys, and other items to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married and is a loving father of four children. He is 36-years of age and has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years. He grows rice and then sells it at a more profitable price. He wants to expand his business and make a good profit to improve their poor living situation. He is now then requesting a loan amount PHP 20,000  to purchase of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

He hopes to grow his business and gain enough profits to save for the college education of his four children and for the next sowing season of his business.

loans.use: to purchase of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Cresentia

texts.en:
Cresentia is 35 years old and is married to Peter, who is a high school teacher. The couple is blessed with four children between five and sixteen years old. For the past 11 years, Cresentia has been a dairy farmer and she earns a monthly income of 16,600 KES. 

Cresentia is requesting her first loan with KADET to buy hay and molasses and to pay for veterinary services. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her loan to start rearing poultry. Cresentia hopes to be a large-scale dairy farmer in future.

loans.use: to buy hay and molasses

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 25-year-old a married woman with two children; both of them are in school. She's had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 and is separated. She lives in the Philippines and is a farmer who cultivates bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. Jane has been a member of GDMPC for four years.

Jane is requesting a 4,870 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to improve and  expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a 37-year-old married father of three children between the ages of nine and four, is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya producing milk, maize, tea and beans which he sells to the local market. He runs a retail shop business as well.

William has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him to acquire a better grade of cow that will help improve his farming income and pay for the education of his children. Althogh fluctuation in milk prices makes the business quite unpredictable, William remains optimistic about business growth over time.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 39-year-old man from Western Kenya and is married to Grace. They have six children who depend on them.

Wycliffe makes bricks for construction purposes. He has been doing this business for the last 11 years and makes a monthly profit of KES 20,000. He is taking his fourth loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to buy more soil for bricks and to buy water for preparing the soil.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees and home upkeep and will plow back the remaining income into the business.

loans.use: to buy more soil for brick making and to buy water for soil preparation.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 43, is married and has four children. She lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Editha sells peanuts to earn a living, and she has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase peanuts to sell.

Editha joined PMPC in 2011. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to sell.

location.town: Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has three children. She is 29 years old and lives in Tonggo, Tudela.

Gina is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. Gina has been doing this for 10 years. 

Gina has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops.

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en:
Fidelis, age 38 years, is married to Annastacia and they are blessed with four children. 

He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for 13 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 8,700 from the business.

This is his first loan term with KADET. He will use the funds to buy milking cans, deworming medicine and seedlings and to repair the cattle shed.

Fidelis hopes to educate his children. His dream is to grow his business into a large-scale dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy milking cans, deworming medicine and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for hog raising.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en:
Jacklin is a 40-year-old a married woman with seven children; four of them are in school. She's had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for five years.

Jacklin is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo, 31, earns a living raising pigs. He is married and has four children, the oldest of whom is five years old.

Leonardo has had his business for four years. He earns 4,000 PHP per month. Leonardo works hard to improve his business and to support his family. He plans to use his loan to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies. 

Leonardo is hoping to have a better income so he can save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en: Elpidio a 45-years-old and takes care of four children at home. He manages a farm in order to ensure food security for his family. Elpidio is a hardworking, conscientious man. He is married. His wife works as a full-time house wife. He grows and sells crops. He began growing rice. He is continuing his business and wants to expand it. Elpidio would like to receive a loan to purchase seeds to grow and fertilizer and pay workers' salaries.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is widowed and has six children. Teofila is 62 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban.

Teofila is a fish vendor and sells seafood to earn a living. Teofila has been doing this for six years.

Teofila has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase seafood such as fish and shrimp.

Teofila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Teofila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seafood such as fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is married and has five children. He is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Mario is a farmer and he grows bananas to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years and every month he earns 8,000 PHP from this work. 

He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Mario has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Mario hopes to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Suat

texts.en: Suat, a 38-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school, has had a business selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan for five years. Suat is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal, and she will use the resulting extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old and single.

He has been in the maize milling business for the last eight years from which he earns a monthly income of KES 80,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 80,000. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more bags of maize for milling, He plans to sell branded maize flour in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize for milling and selling.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan, 60, is married  and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a driver in the Ministry of the Interior in Phnom Penh city. His wife runs a grocery store at home. His son is a garment worker. 

Ngan requests a loan of USD $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his son to commute to work. 

In the future, he would like to run a poultry farm, build a kitchen and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his son to commute to work.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 64 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. She is married and has five children.
 
Rosalita has a general store that sells a variety of goods. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Rosalita requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Rosalita hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and is married with four children. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. Maria is a food vendor who makes rice cakes and other delicacies to sell to her community. She also helps her husband keep their rice crops healthy. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as sugar and flour and also to purchase fertilizer. She hopes that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as sugar and flour and also to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en:
Delfin is married. His wife's name is Rebecca. They have two children. Delfin has his own business; he is engaged in farming.

Delfin grows agriculture crops such as rice and corn. He likes this business, and he wants to develop it. Delfin is industrious, enterprising, and goal oriented. This business is the main source of income for Delfin's family.

Delfin is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will help him increase profits and improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Kimiti

texts.en:
Kimiti is 24 and single. For the past year, he has operated a retail shop and earns a monthly income of 2,000 KES. 

Kimiti is requesting his first loan with KADET to buy sugar, rice, and flour to sell. In the future, he hopes to start a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Rollen

texts.en:
Rollen is 22 years old and single with two children. He is newly separated from his live-in partner and he lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor, Siquijor. For the past three years, Rollen has been a farmer who grows vegetables to earn a living. He earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month and has been a member of PMPC for one month.

Rollen is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. He hopes to expand his business and sustain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie has been involved in the farming business for over 15 years and has good experience in it. He is married and has three responsible children. His children help him with the business and earned PHP 15,000 in the last crop. He uses his profits to make repairs to his house and purchases for their daily needs. Until now, he was not be able to put aside finances for his business. So he is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase sowing seeds and fertilizers. Hopefully, with the help of his requested loan he could then obtain abundant profit in order to expand his business and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase sowing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
This is Lolito, who is 21 years old and single. He is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines who works hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. Lolito operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lolito earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling small quantities. His store is located adjacent to his house and his regular customers are his neighbors and local community members. Lolito earns a minimum of 300 PHP every day.

Lolito is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate his business. He will buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. Lolito expects a boost in his business income as he expands. Lolito faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is 39 and is married with three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Navy is a rice farmer and she also raises pigs. Her husband sells mats, mosquito nets, and quilts in other provinces. 

Navy is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to raise capital and buy more mats, mosquito nets, and quilts for her husband to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business, build a wooden house, and support her children studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy mats, mosquito nets, and quilts to sell

loans.name: Muktaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is 41 years old, married, and has two sons. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her children. Her elder son is an embroidery expert while the younger one works in the factory.

Her husband is a driver while Mukhtaran herself is also a working lady. She does decorative embroidery. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will buy clothes and embroidery material such as beads and embroidery frames in bulk quantity to be able to prepare better quality embroidered clothes and increase her income.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that an investment will help her to improve her business further.

Note: ”In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Mukhtaran.”

loans.use: To buy clothes, beads, and embriodery frames for decorative embriodery business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 28-year-old man. He is married to Moraa and they have one child, but they support three other children.

For five years he has been in the art-selling business, from which he earns a monthly income of approximately 80,000 KES. He is applying for his second loan through KADET LTD, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES. He explains that he promptly and successfully repaid the previous loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more artwork for sale and to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional artwork.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a 40-year-old man living in the Philippines. He is separated from his wife, but he has one child.

To earn a living, Roger operates a service-based business. Specifically, he provides transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for 27 years, and every month he earns approximately 4,000 PHP from this work.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,389.78 PHP to repair a transport vehicle that is used in his business. Roger has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Roger hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a business vehicle

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is from the village of San Juan. He is 45 years old, married, and lives with his family. His wife Racquel is a full-time house wife. Johnny works as farmer in the village. He is actively involved in farming activities. 

Johnny requested credit amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his crop production, and to educate his children.

His hope is to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land, and build rental houses. He is a hard-working man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow for his farm

loans.name: Kim Rong

texts.en:
Kim Rong is a 38-year-old, married woman. She resides with her husband and their four children in Takeo province, Cambodia.

She and her husband are rice farmers. Additionally, her husband is a village leader.

Kim Rong is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike for use by her family. In the future, she plans to grow mushrooms, build a new house, and support her children so that they can study to receive a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for use by her family

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo is a 50-year-old, married man. He and his wife have four children, and they live in Canghunog-hunog, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Camilo operates a furniture business. He has run this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP. He explains that this is the major source of income for his family.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase materials for his furniture business. In the future, Camilo hopes to grow his business and have a permanent location to display his finished product.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his furniture business

loans.name: Kroem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kroem is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.

She is a farmer, but she also works for a grocery shop in her community to generate additional income for her family. She is able to earn approximately of $1.50 per day to provide basic necessities for her children.

Due to insufficient funds, she and her family do not have a vehicle, so the family has to walk or pay for a motor-taxi service to get anywhere they need to go. As a result, she is now seeking a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle, which can be used to provide transportation for her whole family. This motorcycle will save the family money in the long run by helping them avoid paying for a motor-taxi service. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions and her business through the use of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 25-year-old, single woman. She runs a retail shop, which she has been operating for four years. The business earns her a monthly income of approximately 8,500 KES.

This is her first loan requested through KADET. She plans on using the funds to buy sugar, rice, and wheat flour for re-sale purposes. Mercy would like to open a hotel with the anticipated profits generated as a result of the loan, and she hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods (e.g., wheat flour, sugar, and rice)

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 44-year-old, married man. He and his wife have ten children, and they live in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Rodrigo is a farmer; specifically, he plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Rodrigo has been doing this for eight years, and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP every month from this work.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, he was better able to engage in business activities and to improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Rodrigo hopes to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 30-year-old, married man from Gaza. 

On September 1, 2011, Shadi opened his own cell phone store. He is seeking this loan to buy a display case for his store as well as a computer. He believes that these improvements will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a display case for his store and a computer

loans.name: Donna Kerr

texts.en:
Donna Kerr is a 31-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have one child, and they live in Locsoon, Tudela.

To earn a living, Donna Kerr operates a store that sells a variety of goods. Donna Kerr has had this business for several years.

Donna Kerr is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, and detergents. Donna Kerr has been a member of PMPC for 8 months. In the future, Donna Kerr hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods (e.g., noodles, beverages, and detergents).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Phea, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Phea is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase chickens in order to run a poultry farm. In the future, she would like to invest more money in order to expand her poultry farm. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study until they get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase chickens in order to run a poultry farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for six years. Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 37, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to James, a driver. She is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Rosita operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are footwear, sandals and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of sandals and slippers to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosita dreams to have another store in another place and also to be able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of sandals and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 30 years old. He is married to Teresia. They are blessed with three children, ages 8, 5 and 1 years, respectively. Shadrack has been operating motorcycle transport for the past 3 years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Shadrack will use the loan to buy a motor bike. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will service the old motor bike.

His hope and dream is to open a spare parts shop where the wife will be in charge.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina, a 53-year-old energetic woman, lives with her family: a husband and six children who are 28, 25, 23, 21, 19 and 12 years old. Besides her eldest son, all of her children are free and don’t do anything. Her son is a government employee. 

Her husband is a driver by profession. His business is going well and generates good income every month. 

Sakina is a talented lady, and she owns and operates a business making flower testers (canopies, as over a bed). She offers her services for marriages and parties. She prepares beautiful-looking flower testers and also decorates them for her regular clients for their marriage functions. 

She has been operating her business for over 28 years and has a good reputation among her clients for her services.  

With this loan, she will purchase artificial as well as fresh flowers and thread in larger quantity for preparing beautiful looking testers for growing her business. 

She is quite hopeful that her business will return her good profits after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sakina”.

loans.use: To buy artificial and fresh flowers and thread for a business making flower testers (canopies, as over a bed)

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is married with 3 children. He is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marlon owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different product to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years and every month he earns 30,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. He has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. 

In the future, Marlon hopes to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Three of her children are employed at the garment factory. Vannak, requests a loan of 625 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to grow vegetables to sell at the market, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan, 36, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Jonathan operates a barbeque stall. He regularly buys fish and meat that he prepares to cook and sell in the afternoon in his barbeque stand near his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fish and meat products needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jonathan hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish and meat needed in his business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 54, is married and resides with his wife and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a distiller. Additionally, he is a taxi driver who carries garment workers to the factory. His wife is also a distiller and raises pigs. Due to his truck breaking down. Sok is requesting a loan of USD 800 to pay for his truck repairs. By doing so, he can safely carry garment workers to the factory and earn more money to support the family. In the future, Sok would like to buy one more truck to expand his transportation service to increase his income. In addition, he plans to build a new wooden house and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to pay for his truck repair

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 39, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gil, a driver, and is the mother of seven children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Imelda operates a market stall. She sells vegetable, raw products and condiments items in the community market. She buys quantities of vegetables products and other common items used in cooking and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetable products and condiment items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Imelda dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and to build a house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of vegetables and products needed in her business

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son, age 35, is living with her husband and a lovely child in Kompong Cham province. She has built a wooden piggery where she raises pigs in her yard. It’s big enough for 5-7 piglets. She raises pigs for slaughter, earning  approximately $1.50 per day. After she finishes harvesting her rice crop, she intends to spend most of her time  dealing with her pig raising project. 

Son is asking for some funds from HKL to purchase a few additional piglets and feed to fatten her pigs. She hopes that she’ll be able to make this micro business run successfully and make it profitable soon.

loans.use: to purchase a few additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Toun

texts.en:
Toun is a 49-year-old, married man. He resides with his wife and their two children in Takeo province, Cambodia.

To earn a living, he and his wife are vegetable vendors. His two children are garment workers.

Toun is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to raise capital for his business so that he can purchase more vegetables to resell to his customers. In the future, he would like to expand his business and to build a kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables for resale purposes

loans.name: I Made

texts.en:
Living in an area of dense population, it's become a challenge for I Made. I Made, 53, lives in the suburban areas near the beach in West Bali. He has been running a pig business for almost 10 years. Previously, he lived in rural areas, but three years ago, he moved to the place he lives in now. 

Currently he has 21 fattening pigs, 1 sow, 1 male and a cage, which has a width of 10m and length of 2.5 m. His business is growing because he produces good quality pigs. Because the number of pigs is increasing, they produce more and more dirt as well. I Made dug a hole for drainage. Because the hole was not able to accommodate disposal of the waste, it's become pollution for residents around his house. I Made heard about the biogas program from socialization by MUK at the village office. He immediately joined the program and built a biogas reactor in the back of the cage. Currently the construction of the reactor is in progress. I Made is hoping with the biogas reactor, in addition to reducing costs in the kitchen, pollution to the environment can be overcome.

loans.use: To build a biogas reactor

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan is an expert in clothes sewing and decorative embroidery. Due to her good quality of work, she receives regular orders every month.

Her husband is a mason by profession and constructs houses and buildings on order. He is 60 years old and has been doing his business since his teens.

Hanifaan is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her children. Her sons work while her daughters stay at home and help Hanifaan in her daily routine tasks.

She has applied for a loan for her eldest son who is a mason. With the loan investment, he will buy masonry tools to provide better quality masonry services to his clients and increase his income.

He has been operating his business for the past many years, and Hanifaan is hopeful that an investment will help him earn better profits.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools for mason business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 30-year-old, single mother of one child. 

To earn a living, she runs a butcher shop, which she has been operating for six years. The business earns her a monthly income of approximately 22,100

This is her second loan request through KADET. She has a good credit history. She will use the loan proceeds to  add extra hotel services within the butchery premises hence the need to  buy rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour for cooking in the hotel. Anne hopes to open a modern, classic hotel in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods (e.g., rice, cooking oil, and flour) for hotel she plans to operate within  the premise.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en: Joaquin is a 48-year-old married man living with his wife and children. He started working as a farmer 15 years ago and is specialized in cultivating rice. Some of his children are still attending school, and this is the reason he was obliged to do this job in order to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm. In the future, he plans to diversify his business operation and start cultivating different types of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en:
Samneang is a 25-year-old, married man. He and wife reside with their one child in Takeo province, Cambodia. He explains that he also looks after his mother.

To earn a living, he is a driver for a local organization. His wife is a garment worker.

Samneang is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase cows to raise and resell when they are bigger. In the future, he would like to run a sewing shop for his wife and send his kid to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 46-year-old, widowed woman with one son. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.

For the past eight years, Anh has run a food stall to earn a living. She sells steamed rice pancakes and pork pies to her customers.

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture, cooking appliances, and high-quality ingredients. She hopes that this will enable her to draw more customers, increase the sales of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more furniture, cooking appliances, and high-quality ingredients

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 61-year-old, married woman. She and her husband, Charles, are blessed to have three children.

To earn a living, she sells water, which she has been doing for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of approximately 30,000 KES.

This is her first loan requested through KADET. She plans to use the loan proceeds to dig a borehole for use in her business. Lorna intends to invest the anticipated profits generated as a result of the loan back into her water project.

loans.use: To dig a borehole

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 40-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives with her husband and sons in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dung has been running a food stall for nearly eight years. She sells noodles for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to sell in her food stall to better meet her customers' demand. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, age 44, and her husband live in Ho Chi Minh City. They have two daughters.

Hong and her husband have been earning a living by operating a beverage store in the front of their house for the past twenty years. They sell a variety of soft drinks and fruit juice. 

Hong would like to borrow money to expand her current business and hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her current business by purchasing a greater variety of beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 29 year old a business lady. She is married to Martin. They are blessed with one child, age 3 years. She has been running a stationary shop for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 
Judith is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Judith will use the loan to add a stock of printing papers and plain papers to her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her stationary shop  and  improve the family’s living standard.

loans.use: To add a stock of printing papers and plain papers to her shop

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en: Feliciano is married and is a loving father of five children. He is a smart and goal-oriented person. He has been involved in farming activities for five years. Farming brings in a stable income, and this is why Feliciano continues this business and wants to expand it. He has another great wish, and it is to see his children as educated people in the future. With this goal in mind, he works very hard day after day. Feliciano wants to obtain a loan in the sum of PHP 15,000 for the purchase of fertilizer and seed to grow. He hopes very much to get your support and help.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow for his farm business

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold is 30 years old and lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hentii province, Mongolia. He started his transportation business in 2007 with his own car.  Now he owns a van and does transportation across the countryside. However, his van's engine broke down.
