Therefore, Batbold is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to replace the engine and to replace his tires to enable the van to survive the harsh Mongolian winter. Batbold is a sharp and hardworking man who says"It has been horrible since my van broke down. I need to act aggressive in order to make this right".

loans.use: To buy an engine and winter tires for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a responsible and loving mother to her only child. Her husband's name is Aristotle. She established a business selling soap, shampoo, colognes, and laundry and bath soap to the people in her neighborhood. With this kind of business, she earns about PHP 40,000 each month. She utilized the income to pay the allowance and tuition fee of her child. Other parts of her income were used for daily meals and electric bills.

She would like to stock more items to sell but she has insufficient capital so she is asking for PHP 50,000 to buy colognes, bath soap, and laundry soap to sell to the people in their neighborhood. She would like to increase her income so that she saves for future expenses for the college education of her child.

With her continuous operation of the business, she hopes to further diversify it to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy colognes, bath soap, and laundry soap to sell to the people in her neighborhood

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a middle aged lady who lives in Gweru town with her family. She is in the business of buying and selling cellphone accessories, such as chargers, batteries, memory cards and handsets. 

Christine started doing business five years ago. She is requesting a loan of $800.00 so that she can buy more stock to maximize on profits. With the income from this loan, she will manage to purchase furniture and fittings for her shop. She will also buy food and clothing for her family. Christine is planning to diversify into selling electrical goods in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding metals for his business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, a mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in local school, is married to a factory worker who earns a low income. She is a very good housewife, and her family is very happy with her efficiency and her supportive nature.

Nasreenhas is very skillful and makes thread from used clothes. Now requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah, she will buy used clothes in bulk quantity to make thread to sell to her clients for profit. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that the loan will help her to earn more income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her thread-making business

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.en: It was decided  to name the shop, in which Cholpon sells, "Milan" - in honor of her youngest daughter. Currently, Cholpon has increased the range of goods and clientele, the store is popular as it is located on the central road of the Belovodskoye village. In order to raise holiday sales in the New Year's Eve, Cholpon has applied to "Bai Tushum and Partners" company for a loan in the amount of 80.000 KGS for reconstruction the store showcase, opening of new showcase of confectionery and replenishment of inventory. Cholpon plans to invest the profits from this loan to the reconstruction of the shop and partial renovation of her house.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Gregory Mark

texts.en:
Gregory Mark is newly wed to May, he is 43 years old and they have one infant aged daughter. Gregory is a very hardworking man and patient in his work. He has been involved in a farming business for five years.

Gregory Mark is requesting a loan of P 15,000 to purchase a sack of rice seed and manure for fertilizer. Gregory hopes that he can expand his business, and to build their own house someday.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, aged 30 years, is married to Catherine and they are blessed with one child, aged three years. Julius operates a motorcycle transport business that has been in operation for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kes 7,200.

This is Julius' first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to service his motorbike by buying new tyres and brakes, etc. Julius hopes to buy a taxi in the future.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spares for repair.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 49 and has four children.  

Huong's husband is a worker. Huong has been earning a living by operating a food stall for nearly ten years. She sells noodles for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demands. 

Huong hopes that, through the loan, she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food.

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric is a diligent father, and has no other desire but to uplift his family's living. Ric is 39 years of age, married to a housekeeper and they are blessed with one kid. 

Ric has been engaged in a rice farming business for almost 11 years. With his desire, he is doing his best to get better yields and gain income. Ric always looks for a higher income from the business, that’s why he keeps on visiting his crops to ensure that it is in good condition. He applied the exact amount of fertilizers needed in farming for better results.

Due to the high cost of farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds, Ric is asking for a financial support amounting P25,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow. He hopes to attain his desire through the business he runs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam is 54 years old.  She a widow with five children. She supports her family by selling meals in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy better food to sell at higher margins.   She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy better food to sell from her food stall

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 30 year old a married woman with five children, and all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Kator, South Sudan for three years.

Aida is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old a business lady.  She is married to Wainaina. They are blessed with 7 children. 

Mary has been a tailor for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000 which she uses to support her family.  She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  

Mary will use the loan to buy more stock of cloth material. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy another sewing machine.  Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and build rental houses to increase her income.

loans.use: buy textile materials for her tailor business

loans.name: Mudassira's Group

texts.en:
Mudassira is very supportive by nature. She operates a clinic in her community area and provides medical facilities to her community's women.
She is an expert in her work and has been offering her services for the past many years. Female patients from different parts of the city come to her and trust her services.

Mudassira is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Both of her sons work in the factory while her daughter stays at home.

She has applied for a loan for the improvement of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy medicines and tools to offer better quality medical services to her clients, and improve her income as well as her client's health.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her medical clinic

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alex is a 55-year-old a business man.  He is married to Colleta. They are blessed with two children, aged 7 and 5 years. He has been running a hotel  for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

Alex is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar and rice for his hotel.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build a shed for his livestock and open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: buy sugar and rice for his hotel

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
At her age of 63, Esterlita can still manage a farming business. Esterlita has managed a rice farming business for 45 years. With her long duration of experience in farming, she is proud to say that she is already an expert in planting rice. She is married and has one child.

Since she is managing their farm, Esterlita admits that her income from every crop is not enough to finance her expenses in farming. Esterlita wishes to have enough capital to maintain the business. She is requesting a loan of P27,000 to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost in farming.

Esterlita hopes that she will earn higher income from the business and save some of it for her family's future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost in farming.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 27, is a single man who runs a photo studio that has been in operation for eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 18,000.

This is his fifth loan with KADET Ltd and he has a good credit history.  He will use the funds to buy a digital camera and a computer.  Peter hopes to own a studio lab in the future.

loans.use: buy a digital camera and a computer

loans.name: Santalina

texts.en:
Santalina is 40 year old a married woman. She has five children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator South Sudan for three years.

Santalina is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 27 years old and married to Nyanchama.  They has one child.

Erick operates a curio shop and has been in business for the past two years.  He earns a monthly income of 13,000 KES.  This is his second loan from KADET ltd. He paid the previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan to purchase items for his curio shop.

He hopes to use the profits generated by this loan to expand his business and open an additional curio shop in the nearby trading centre.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his curio shop.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 51 years old.  She is a single mother of two children aged 29 and 30 years. She operates a computer services business and has been in business for four years. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES running this business.

This is Milka’s fourth loan with KADET ltd. and she has a good credit history.  She will use this loan to buy a printer and a computer.  In the future, Milka hopes to start a printing business.

loans.use: to buy a printer and a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase knitting materials and livestock feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is 41 years old.  She is married with two children and lives in Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga.

To earn a living, Elita operates a small gasoline business.  She has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP to purchase 10 gallons of gasoline to sell.  She has been in business for five years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP each month.  Elita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 24 years old.  He is single and supports his parents. He has been operating a motor bike transport as a primary business and a poultry rearing operation as a secondary business for the past three years.   He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000,  which he uses for his basic needs.

Samuel is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  He will use the loan to buy a motor bike and more poultry feeds.  With the anticipated profit from the businesses, he will service the motor bike. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi, which will help him increase his income.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle and more poultry feeds

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg is a 43-year-old single father.  He lives with his 20-year-old daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His daughter is a college student and his wife died in 2007. 

Erdenebileg started his taxi service business in 2006.  His business is the only income for the family. His car broke down and he needs to replace its engine. He is requesting 600,000 MNT to replace his car's engine.  

Erdenebileg is a hardworking and diligent man who says "It has been horrible since my car got broken. I have to do everything I can to make this right."

loans.use: buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a loving mother to her family. She has been married to Jacinto for almost 10 years. They have four children. Her commitment to her family drives her to work hard in her food-selling business. She sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her neighborhood. She has a food stall just in front of her house. She usually earns 16,000 Philippines pesos (P) monthly in this kind of business, and the income pays for the allowances and other school fees of her children.

As of now, she has insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan of P25,000 to further develop her business. She will buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggs, fish and meat to sell.

In the future, Josefina would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggs, fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армен родился в 1973 г. в городе Каджаране, где и окончил среднюю школу. 
Армен женат и у него трое детей. Жена Армена домохозяйка, старшая дочь учиться в школе, а младшая дочь и сын посещяют детский сад. Также вместе с ним проживает его мать-пенсионерка. 
Три года назад Армен переоборудовал подвал своего дома в мастерскую, в которой он изготовляет мебель на заказ. Основной акцент Армен делает на изготовление кухонной мебели и компьютерных столов. Для увеличения пробыли своей семьи, Армен также арендует небольшой магазин, в котором он продает готовую мебель. Благодаря своему бизнесу он смог купить небольшой грузовой автомобиль, с помощью которого Армен привозит сырью из города Капана, а также готовую мебель из Еревана для продажи в магазине. 
Армену необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для приобретения необходимого сырья для изготовления мебели. 
Армен работает до позднего вечера и без выходных, что позволяет ему получать доход, необходимый для содержания своей семьи.
texts.en:
Armen finished middle school in Kadjaran, the city of his birth. He's married and has three children. Armen's wife takes care of their household and his elder daughter attends school, while his two younger children go to daycare. Armen's retired mother lives with them. 
Three years ago, Armen converted his basement into a workshop in which he now makes furniture on a by-order basis. His main focus is on kitchen furniture and computer desks. In order to increase his income, Armen rents a a small store where he places products ready for sale. 
Because of his business, Armen was able to purchase a truck. He transports building materials from Kapan and made furniture from Yerevan on it. 
Armen is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 drams to purchase building materials for new furniture. In order to successfully support his family, he works till late without weekends.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for furniture production.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 25 years old and single.  He is a farmer with four years of experience in dairy farming.  His produce of milk is sold to the local market. He gets additional income from his employment as a machine attendant.

Thomas has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to boost his farming income. He says it is economical to have many dairy cows in order to reduce the overall cost, especially that of treatment and transportation on animal feeds. He is optimistic with the business, saying he will manage to run a farm of five dairy cows.

He reiterates the major challenge he faces is on treatment for the animals.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 50 years old and lives in Tonggo, Tudela.  He is married and has 3 children. 

Leonardo has a store that sells variety of goods.  He has had this business for 5 years.  He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products to sell such as noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc. 

Leonardo has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: buy noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 51 years of age. She is luckily married to a farmer. As fruit of their love, they are blessed with four children. Dorothy manages their farming business, which is the planting and harvesting of rice. Aside from the farming business, she is also managing a sari-sari (variety) store business for an additional source of income of the family. Dorothy and her husband are helping each other to carry their family out of poverty.

With regards to her rice farming business, Dorothy is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos to pay for the land preparation of her farm and buy seeds of rice. She looks forward to the success of her business to smoothly carry their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation of her farm and buy seeds of rice.

loans.name: Lentoyian

texts.en:
Lentoyian, aged 57, is a single mother of three children between 18 and 26 years old.  She rears livestock and also runs a retail shop that has been in operation for eight years. The businesses earn her a monthly income of KES 5,000.  This is her third loan with KADET and she has a good credit history. 

Lentoyian will use the funds to buy two goats, pay school fees and buy stock for her shop. She hopes to start a dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: buy 2 goats, pay school fees, and stock her shop

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila, a 54-year-old married mother of seven, lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte where she has sold food for snacks to earn a living for the past six years. Having joined PMPC this year, Mila is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business. She hopes to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah, a 31-year-old businesslady, is married to Allan, and they are blessed with a three-year-old child. Fridah has been running a beauty salon for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Having been introduced to KADET by a staff member, Fridah is applying for her first loan with KADET to buy cosmetics to add to her beauty shop. With the anticipated extra profit from the business she will educate her child.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop which will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan, a 58-year-old father of 10, 4 of whom are still in school, has been farming for 31 years in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. He produces maize, milk and poultry products.

Duncan has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his poultry business by buying more birds and expanding the housing unit. He adds that his many years in farming and poultry in particular have helped him acquire skills for managing the challenges of diseases, the high cost of feeds, and price fluctuations. He is very optimist about the prospects for growth and says he will use the income to educate his children.

Duncan urges Juhudi Kilimo to introduce education loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry and expand a poultry housing unit

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is from Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur province of the Philippines. She is 56 years old, married, and has nine adult children. 

Rosemarie plants, harvests, and sells bananas and corn to earn a living. Rosemarie has been in this business for over thirty-nine years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007 Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the revenue generated to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 50 years old. She is divorced. She lives with her three daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years she has operated a food stall to sell noodles to people in their community.

Le would like a loan to purchase new furniture and good quality food in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and good quality food in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, umbrellas, and jackets.

loans.name: Qui

texts.en:
Qui is 54 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Qui earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 15 years. 

Qui is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and sweets, to stock her general store.  She hopes this will enable her both to better meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract new customers.  Qui also hopes that, through this loan, her business will generate more revenue, enabling her to improve her family's living conditions and save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and sweets.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom is 31 years old and the mother of two young children.  She lives in the Prey Chor district.  To earn a living, she has been involved in rice farming for more than five years.  Prom’s farmland is located near the river, which provides enough water for her rice crops in both rainy and dry seasons.  She is able to generate an income of $2.00 per day through her business. 

At this time, Prom is preparing to build her own house and she needs more funds to complete the construction.  Fortunately, her husband is a construction worker and will gather his own team to perform the work.  As a result, she will pay less for the labor needed to complete the work. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase timber and other materials necessary for construction.  Prom hopes to receive this loan and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase timber and other materials for the construction of her home.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 29 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement.  She is divorced and has three children. 

Rosenda operates a general store that sells variety of products.  She has been in business for five years.  Rosenda has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP in order to purchase more items to stock her general store.

Rosenda has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to stock her general store.

loans.name: Nu

texts.en:
Nu is 54 years old and widowed with one child.  She supports her family by selling steamed glutinous rice in the local community.  She is requesting a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy higher quality food to sell at higher margins. 

She hopes that through this loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy higher quality food to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 24 years old, single and an orphan.  She has been running a music stall for the past year and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES, which she uses to meet her basic needs.

She is applying for her first loan through KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Cecilia will use this loan to buy more compact disks to stock her music stall.  With the anticipated profit generated by the loan, she will provide for her newborn baby.  She hopes and dreams of opening a retail shop, which will enable her to meet all her baby’s needs.

loans.use: to buy compact disks to sell in her music stall.

loans.name: Nyamjargal

texts.en: Nyamjargal is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Nyamjargal has an undergraduate degree in IT engineering, and he opened an internet cafe business in early 2011. He also works as an IT engineer in a major corporation. His wife runs the business and his son goes to kindergarten. Nyamjargal's internet cafe currently operates ten computers; however, these are not enough to run his business. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy six additional computers.

loans.use: to buy six additional computers for his internet cafe business.

loans.name: Diem

texts.en:
Diem is 52 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diem has been running a food stall for nearly twenty years. She sells noodles to people in the local community. She has requested a loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demand. 

Diem hopes that through this loan she can earn more money from her current business and save the additional amount for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.en:
Jhon is an active and diligent man. He is a farmer, and has been 10 years in the farming business. He does this business to be able to support his wife and three children. 

At first, it was hard for him to start in his business because it requires full-time work and needs a great amount of capital. Despite that, he devotes himself to working hard, and requests a loan amount of 20,000 Philippines pesos to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in his farmland.

Hopefully, he can increase his previous income to save for the future of his family and the education of his children as well.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in his farmland.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis used his previous loan to buy shoes for resale. He is still faced with challenges of price fluctuation, inflation, and high transportation costs. In addition to his dream of buying land to build rental houses, he would also like to buy a car to simplify the transportation of his shoes to the different markets. Francis needs the new loan to buy more used shoes to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Chematia

texts.en:
Chematia is a mother of four adult children and lives with her family in Eldoret, where she has been active in farming for over 10 years through intensive production of maize for the local market.

Chematia has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She says she will be able to have an all-season production of poultry, unlike maize farming, which takes place only twice a year and is highly influenced by weather conditions. She adds that the increased income will improve her standard of living.

Chematia notes, additionally, that their small parcels of land are a limitation on the production of crops like maize.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Saidali

texts.ru: Сайдали женат и имеет четверых детей. Он ответственный и целеустремленный человек. За последние годы он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Он любит работать на земле и с удовольствием занимается этим. Сайдали выращивает пшеницу, картофель и кукурузу. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений, горюче-смазочных материалов и семян. Сайдали надеется на нашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Saidali is married and has four children.  He is a responsible and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for the last few years.  He loves working on the land and does so with satisfaction.  Saidali grows wheat, potatoes and corn.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds.  Saidali relies on our help and is grateful to you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 53 years old. She is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling soft drinks. 

For the past fifteen years, she has run a drink stall to cover her family's daily living expenses. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions, and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Mutwiwa

texts.en:
Mutwiwa is a 39-year-old business man.  He is married to Tabitha, and they are blessed with two children, aged 12 and 9 years, respectively. He has been running a retail shop for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

Mutwiwa is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mutwiwa will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking oil for his store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a single, hardworking young man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in the motorcycle transportation business and currently has to give 80% of his daily earnings to his boss. Because of this challenge, he has a desire to buy his own motorcycle. Peter needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en: Oyunjargal is 41 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard and her son is a college student. She started her business in 2009 by renting a counter in a market. Her business income and husband's salary are not quite enough to pay her son's college fee; therefore, she needs to expand her business to increase her income. She has already rented another counter in a market; however, she does not have enough supply to run the entire counter. Therefore, Oyunjargal is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 31 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. 

Vergie sells cloth to earn a living; she has had this business for eight months. Each month, she earns 4000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3000 PHP to purchase t-shirts and pants to sell/retail.

Vergie became a member of PMPC this year (2011). In the future, Vergie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  t-shirts and pants to sell/retail.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is 29 years old, married, and blessed with a three-year-old child.  To earn a living, he recycles metals to make window and door frames.  He has been in this business for four years and has employed two people.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management skills.  This has helped him in budgeting and good record-keeping.

Luke hopes to expand his business premises in the future.  He needs a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy scrap metals and metal rods.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals and metal rods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries for sale.

loans.name: Kalmamat

texts.ru: Калмамат – 51-летний фермер, женат, имеет пятерых  детей. В целях обеспечения своей семьи средствами дохода, в 2007 году Калмамат начал свой бизнес, использовав в качестве стартовой суммы  кредит компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Калмамата имеются дойная корова, пять баранов и корма на зиму. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса и увеличения поголовья, Каламамат обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в расширение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Kalmamat is a 51 year-old farmer, married and has five children.  In order to provide for his family with income sources, he started his own business in 2007, using a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company as an initial sum.  Today, thanks to hard work, Kalmamat's business has a dairy cow, five sheep and fodder for the winter.  In order to further expand his business and increase livestock headcount, he requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  He plans to invest the profits from this loan into business expansion.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plumbing materials.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol, 32 and a mother of 2 school-age children, has been residing in Kompong Cham province. She earns a living by cultivating rice crops on her own farmland. 

With her first loan from Kiva, she intends to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her whole family to use.  This will also better the way she lives and works. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 47 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children. 

Precila sells food for snacks to earn a living. She has had this business for year. Precila has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Precila has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 38-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is motorcycle transport, which he started six years back. Alongside his motorcycle business, he has a retail shop; this has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. His business dream is to own a wholesale shop selling a variety of merchandise. Joseph needs the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to earn a living. She is happily married to the supervisor of Yakult. The couple are blessed with two adult children. Both of them have settled in marriage and are separately living with their own families.

Mercedes owns her variety store, and she has had this business for three years. She is aiming to increase her product offering to satisfy her customer demand, but her income is insufficient. In regards to this, she is asking for a loan amount of 50,000 Philippines pesos. She will be using her requested loan to buy merchandise for her retail store. She believes that her sacrifices will lead her to reach her goal, which is to increase her profit and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, and has been practicing maize farming for eight solid years. Emily says her family of four school-going children fully relies on her farming income for their daily meals and education. 

Emily has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to commence dairy farming by buying and insuring a dairy cow. She wants to diversify her farming business to spread the risks due to challenges of the cereals industry, especially the government, which is the recipient of a majority of maize farmers' supply. She adds that she will soon be keeping poultry as well.

Emily notes the poor road networks and high cost of feeds are among the challenges she faces.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 38 years old and married and has four children who are in school.  To earn a living, he recycles metals to make door and window frames. He has been in this business for six years. He also gets contracts for painting houses and earns extra income from this. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Thomas has been trained in business management.  This has helped him to improve his business and hence his living standards.

Thomas hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested a loan for 30,000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to buy scrap metals and metallic rods for his business.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals and metal rods.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 58 years old and married to Francis.

Alice has been in her present business for the last twelve years. She earns a monthly income of KES 70,000. She is applying for her fifth loan of KES 100,000; she paid the previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Alice hopes to use the funds to buy more grocery produce for sale and to open up another grocery shop in the nearby trading center.

loans.use: To buy more stock of grocery produce for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 26-year-old young man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business, which he started two years ago, is selling secondhand shoes. He started the business with capital of only three hundred shillings, but now it is worth one million five hundred thousand shillings. In spite of this, he faces challenges including price fluctuations, inflation, and high transportation costs. His desire is to buy land to grow crops and diversify his business into a boutique. Stephen needs this loan to buy used shoes to resell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to resell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Более 5 лет Исмоил занимается откармливанием скота. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Исмоил является владельцем бизнеса и имеет богатый опыт. Он начал свой бизнес с продажи сельхозкультур, затем постепенно перешел на продажу скота. На полученную прибыль он построил коровник, а теперь хочет добавить еще несколько голов скота, и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 4500 Сомони. Исмоил хочет закупить скот. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за поддержку.
texts.en: Ismoil has been fattening cattle for more than five years.  He is married and the responsible father of four children.  Ismoil is a business owner and has a wealth of experience. He started his business by selling crops, then gradually moved on to selling cattle.  With the profits already earned, Ismoil  has built a barn.  He would now like to acquire a few more head of cattle.  To this end, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,500 Somoni (TJS).  Ismoil wants to buy cattle.  He looks forward to your help and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is applying for a loan amount of 20,000 Philippines pesos (P) to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in his farming business. He is 27 years of age and has had this occupation for over five years. He earns P17,000 after every six months of hardship. His family is still experiencing deficiencies with his profit, so he decided to seek a loan.

He wants to make this investment because it will allow him to improve his means of work. He has committed himself to this business, to work hard and manage responsibly in order to repay the loan in the right time after a better and precious crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: Gorreti is a hardworking single parent with one child.  They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her goal is to educate her child. Her current business is selling pharmaceuticals in her shop, which she started two years ago. However her challenge is lack of enough capital to expand her business. Her desire is to have her pharmacy well known in her town. Gorreti needs this loan to buy pharmaceuticals to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals to sell in  her pharmacy

loans.name: Ama Enyonam

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a 1 enfant.
Ama travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des ustensiles de ménage et des produits de beauté pour tous au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Ama a requis son 2ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ustensiles de ménage et des produits de beauté. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ama is 38 years old, married to a mechanic and the mother of one child. She has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells household utensils and beauty products for men and women at the market. She gets the supplies for her one-woman business in Lomé and is not currently experiencing any difficulties.

Ama is requesting her second loan from WAGES so that she can invest in her business and restock on household items and beauty products for resale. In the coming years, she would like to open a shop. She will use the profits from her business to take care of her family.

loans.use: to restock on household utensils and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds and a dairy cow and to insure the cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David used his previous loan to buy crates of beer and local gin for resale. His main challenges have been price fluctuations, inflation, and high taxes levied on him. He started with capital of 500,000 shillings, but now it is worth 2,000,000 shillings. David needs this loan to buy local gin for resale this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy local gin for resale this Christmas season.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo needs to work hard and do his best just to feed his children. Romeo is 58 years old and married. They are blessed with four children. Romeo has operated a rice farming business for 35 years.

With his years in farming, Romeo admits that his capital in farming is borrowed from the traders. He has no choice even though it has a high interest rate because if he does not borrow from the traders, he can’t operate his farm. 

Romeo wishes for a loan that can help him lessen the interest he pays. He decided to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers that he needs in farming. Through the loan he will borrow from ASKI, he will no longer need to get a loan from the traders and will earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers that he needs in farming.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 36 years old, a mixed crop farmer, married to Mary with one child aged 4 years. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 8,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Pius will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to educate his child up to university level and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Laurah

texts.en: Laurah used her previous loan to buy salt, sugar and rice for resale and managed to use her profits to start up a new business selling clothes along side her retail shop.Her challenge has been price flactuations and inflation, customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. Laurah needs the loan to buy salt, sugar and rice for resale since the demand is high during this season.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and rice for resale

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam, age 31, is a local farmer and her husband works as a construction worker around the province of Kompong Cham. She’s really busy with her work nowadays because it’s time to collect her rice harvest. She has two children who attend a local public school. 

The family has had difficulties in travelling as they don’t own a motorcycle. For this reason, Seam decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle, and with the remaining funds, she’ll buy lubricating oil for her threshing machine. She hopes that she’ll be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle and lubricating oil.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Penninah is a 50 year-old mixed crop farmer, married to Joseph with one child aged 22 years. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 8,000 which he uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing Kadet customer. Penninah will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the living standard of her family

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of five children, three of whom are still of school-going age. She has been in poultry farming for five solid years, with her poultry going to the local market.

Pauline has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into dairy farming. She plans to have five dairy cows in the future in order to enjoy the economies of scale and be among the major suppliers for the local market. 

She states that the major challenge remains animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 43 years old and married to Mweni. They have four children.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

Benson plans to use the funds to buy more feed for poultry farming. He has been in the business for the last eight years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

loans.use: to buy more feed for poultry farming.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 1 enfant.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle vend des céréales, des tubercules d’igname et du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Atakpame, Anié et Notse. Une personne l'aide dans l'exercice de ses activités. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Afiwa a requis son 2ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales, des tubercules d’igname et du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a driver and has one child.

Afiwa has been working as a retail merchant since 1995. She sells cereals, yam tubers and charcoal to all-comers from her home. She resupplies in Atakpame, Anié and Notse. She has one person to help her with her business. At this time, she is experiencing no difficulties..

Afiwa requested her second Wages credit loan to purchase cereals, yam tubers and charcoal, as she wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Afiwa wants to increase the size of her business. She said that with the profits she plans to ensure her child's education.

loans.use: Buy grain, yams and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Akhmatzhan

texts.ru: Ахматжану 52 года, женат.  В целях обеспечения своей семьи средствами дохода, в 2009 году Ахматжан начал свой бизнес, использовав в качестве стартовой суммы  кредит компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Ахматжана имеются дойная корова, восемь баранов и корма на зиму. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса и увеличения поголовья, Ахматжан обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в расширение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Ahmatzhan is 52 years old, he is married. In order to provide for his family by the means of income Ahmatzhan has started his own business in 2009 using the loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from Bai Tushum and Partners as a starting capital. Today through hard work Ahmatzhan's farm has a milk cow, eight sheep and fodder for the winter. In order to further expand the business and increase the livestock Ahmatzhan has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS. He plans to invest the income from the loan in expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo has been working in the farming business for 10 years planting rice.

He is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 in order to continue working in his business and to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. This is the only source of their income, which he uses for expenses for the lives of his wife and four children. Hence, he responsibly works in the field every day just to maintain his business well.

He just hopes to increase his profit to develop his family’s living and also his valued farming business.

loans.use: to continue working in his business and to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian, aged 28 years, is married to James. They are blessed with one child, aged three years. 

Vivian sells seat covers and textiles and has been doing this for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This is her second loan with KADET; she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy seat covers and textiles for resale. Vivian hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seat covers and textiles.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been in active farming for four years in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married and has five children aged between 1 and 15 years. He has been producing milk and maize for the local market.

Peter has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He adds he will use the income to improve his farming. He will use the income to improve the living standards of his children.

He is, however, worried about the high costs for running the business, especially with the management of diseases.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old, married, and has one kid. Manuel’s wife is a housekeeper. He has been engaged in the farming business since he was married. He plants and harvests rice.

Manuel wishes for a better way of living for his family. He always finds a way so that his family will not suffer financial shortage. He doesn’t want them to starve because, as a head of the family, he is the one who will provide for the needs of the family.

Manuel wants to achieve his wish. He will continue develop his practice in farming and get a better yield. To achieve his wish, Manuel is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and insecticides. He believes that the loan will have a positive impact for his farming business.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ameh

texts.fr:
Ameh est une femme âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 5 enfants. 
Ameh travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1998. Elle  vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Anié, Notse et Atakpamé. Elle travaille seule.  
Ameh a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ameh voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ameh is a 54-year-old woman. She is married to a teacher and has five children.

Ameh has been working as a retail merchant since 1998. She sells grain to all-comers from her home. She resupplies in Anié, Notse and Atakpamé. She works alone.

Ameh requested her first Wages credit loan to buy bags of grain, as she wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Ameh wants to increase the size of her business. She said that with the profits she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, aged 42 years, is married to Stephen. They are blessed with seven children aged between 8 and 21 years. 

Pamela makes peanut butter and then sells it. She has been doing this for eleven years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 6,000.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the funds to buy peanuts and additives. Pamela hopes to set up a factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and additives.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old.  She is married and has five children.

She operates a tree farm  selling seedlings and mature trees, she has been in business for three years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.  She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES.  A credit officer introduced her to KADET LTD.

She hopes to use the loan  to buy more seeds, in the future she hopes to buy a larger plot of land.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow seedlings and   sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a resident and a farmer in Western Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming and selling milk, maize and kale to the local market. She is married with five children with four already in school.

Teresa has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will be used to improve the living standards of her children. She also wants to buy more land for intensive farming for better income. 

She says the common problems such as diseases and unreliable rainfall remains their main challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 42 years old.  He has been providing transportation services for 14 years and uses his handcart to transport goods.  He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination.  He has also grown his business through the financial support provided by Faulu Kenya.  Edward hopes to open additional business locations in the future and has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a handcart.

loans.use: to buy a handcart.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for six years.

Rosa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Patouani

texts.fr:
Patouani est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un réparateur de radio et télévision. Elle a 4 enfants.
Patouani travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation et d’articles en plastique pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Patouani a requis son 3ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation et des articles en plastique. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Patouani voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de financer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Patouani is 38 years old. She is married to a radio and TV repairman, and they have four children.

Patouani has been a reseller since 2002. She sells food products and plastic wares from her home. She buys her merchandise in Lomé. She works alone, and for the time being, she is not facing any particular difficulties. 

Patouani is seeking a third loan from WAGES to purchase food products and plastic goods. She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Patouani would like to expand her business. She will use the profits earned to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy general food products and plastic wares for resale.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon is 48 years old.  She is a humble farmer from Prey Chor district.  She has operated a farming business with her husband for many years to generate income. She is now blessed with five children.  In addition to farming, her husband climbs sugar palm trees to collect the juice in order to earn additional income.  Whenever her husband collects a lot of palm juice, Chhon makes it into palm sugar and sells it for a profit to the villagers. 

At present, Chhon is not busy with farming work, so she intends to dedicate her time to starting a business raising pigs.  Therefore, she is requesting her third loan through HKL to purchase some piglets to raise.  She hopes that our lenders will continue to support her business activities.  She is very happy and appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets to raise.

loans.name: Salume

texts.en:
Salume is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and lives with her family of three children between 12 and 8 years old in their rural home where she carries out dairy and poultry farming and produces milk and eggs for the local market. She has seven years of experience in farming.

Salume has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming by buying more poultry birds at a cost of 10,000 KES and building a bigger and better housing unit for her growing number of birds. She is optimistic her farming business will continue to grow and earn her enough income to educate the children.

Salume is, however, worried about the rising cost of poultry feed, which is hurting the business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and build a poultry housing unit

loans.name: Njiriri

texts.en:
Njiriri is 50 years old and married to Esther.

He been growing seedlings in his nurseries for sell for four years and earns a monthly income of 7,000.  A credit officer introduced him to KADET LTD and he is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES.

He hopes to use this loan to expand his tree nurseries and seedling selling business.

loans.use: To buy seeds for growing in his nurseries

loans.name: Tilekmat

texts.ru: Тилекмат  - 38 летний фермер, женат, воспитывает четырех сыновей и одну дочь, все школьники. Тилекмат на протяжении 18 лет занимается полеводством, ежегодно обрабатывая 1,8 га земли, где выращивает картофель и кукурузу и собранный  в сезон урожай реализует в г.Бишкек (столица). Внесезонным средством дохода для семьи Тилекмата является животноводство, начатое с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, его хозяйство, начитывающее 2 коровы, 7 телят, 40 овец, 1 лошадь, приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Тилекмат обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят и овец.  Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в реконструкцию сарая для скота.
texts.en: Tilekmat is a 38 year old farmer, he is married and has four sons and one daughter, they are all students. Tilekmat has been involved in arable farming for over eighteen years processing 1.8 hectares of land annually where he grows potatoes and corn and then sells the gathered season's harvest in Bishkek (the capital). Animal husbandry is the off-season source of income for Tilekmat's family which began with the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). At this time his farm accounts for two cows, seven calves, 40 sheep, one horse and brings about 8,000 som per month. In order to further increase the number of livestock Tilekmat has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and sheep. He plans to invest the income from the loan in the reconstruction of the barn for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 36 years old.  He is married to Mary and they have three children.

He has been in the farming business growing food crops for the last 10 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 8,000.He is applying for his first loan of Kes 20,000.He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He plans to use the funds to buy more fertilizers, seeds. In future he hopes is to diversify into carpentry   workshop.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seeds for farming.
